DESCRIPTION: The most famous work of Jan van Eyck is a huge Ghent Altarpiece with many scenes in the city of Ghent.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: It is said to have been begun by Jan's elder brother Hubert, of whom little is known, and was completed by Jan in 1432.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: On the frame a quatrain is inscribed which states that the polyptych was begun by Pictor Hubertus Eyck, and finished by his brother Jan, at the request of Jodocus Vijd, deputy burgomaster of Ghent, warden of the church of St John, and of his wife, Elisabeth Borluut, who commissioned it.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: The verse was placed there when the altarpiece was installed on 6 May 1432.The stylistic analysis reveals that in the painting the work of two different hands can be clearly discerned.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: The overall conception of the altarpiece is the work of Hubert, along with the execution of certain parts, such as the panels in the lower tier.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: Here, the manner is archaic, and reflects the continuing dominance of the international style that was practised by Broederlam.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: The composition is typically unoriginal: the landscape is still conceived as a distant background, with which the figures at the front have no organic relation, an effect that is reinforced by the bird's eye point of view.This polyptych is mystical, not to say esoteric, in intention, and is imbued throughout with both spiritual and intellectual signification.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: When opened, it represents the communion of saints, which is "the new heaven and the new earth", in the words of the Revelation of St John.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: Thus the central panel of the lower tier portrays the saints symbolizing the eight Beatitudes gathered round the altar where the sacrifice of the Lamb is taking place, at the centre of the heavenly garden which has sprung from His blood.To left and right, in the foreground, are two processions facing one another.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: One of these is made up of the Old Testament patriarchs and prophets, and the other of figures from the New Testament.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: Some of them are kneeling, barefoot.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: Behind them is assembled the hierarchy of the Church - popes, deacons and bishops, wearing sumptuous jewelry and clothes in the bright red of martyrdom.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: In the background are two further groups, facing each other as if they had just emerged from the surrounding shrubbery.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: These are, on one side, the Confessors of the Faith, tightly packed together and almost all dressed in blue; and on the other side, the Virgin Martyrs, holding out palm fronds and wearing in their hair crowns of flowers of a kind traditionally worn by young girls at certain holy ceremonies.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: In the middle of the panel, around the altar where the Lamb spills forth his blood, angels kneel, holding the emblems of His Passion.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: Grace is symbolized by a radiant dove hovering in the sky, and eternal life is represented by a fountain in the foreground.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: A paradisiacal landscape runs across all five lower panels, uniting them in a single composition.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: It is strewn with plants from different countries and flowers of different seasons.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: The central panel is vibrant with green, while those to the sides are more arid and rocky.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: The horizon sits high in the frame and is closed off by groves of trees, behind which clusters of fairy-tale buildings can be made out, representing the heavenly Jerusalem.The community of saints also extends onto the side panels.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: Magnificently arrayed horsemen, representing the Soldiers of Christ, are followed by the Just Judges.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: Opposite them are the Holy Hermits who have renounced the world, and the Pilgrim Saints, who were favourite figures of identification throughout the Middle Ages.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: They are led by a giant of a man, St Christopher.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: Many later commentators have suggested that his great height would have reminded the contemporary viewer of Jodocus Vijd's brother, also called Christopher.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: In the middle of the upper tier is God Almighty, the Word, essence and origin of the universe.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: He is dressed in red and is crowned with a magnificent tiara.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: On his left is Mary and on his right, St John the Baptist.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: These central figures are surrounded by angels who are singing or playing instruments.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: At the far right and left of the composition respectively are the figures of Adam and Eve.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: They were painted by Jan Van Eyck, and are set into trompe-l'oeil niches.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: Light and shadow play delicately over their forms which stand out as though they had been sculpted in the round.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece (wings open)

DESCRIPTION: The scene at top of the niche containing the figure of Adam depicts in grisaille the Offering of Abel and Cain.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece: The Offering of Abel and Cain

DESCRIPTION: The scene prefigures both the sacrifice of Christ and the Eucharist
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece: The Offering of Abel and Cain

DESCRIPTION: The community of saints also extends onto the side panels.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece: The Soldiers of Christ

DESCRIPTION: Magnificently arrayed horsemen, representing the Soldiers of Christ, are followed by the Just Judges
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece: The Soldiers of Christ

DESCRIPTION: The Pilgrim Saints, who were favourite figures of identification throughout the Middle Ages, are led by a giant of a man, St Christopher.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece: The Holy Pilgrims

DESCRIPTION: Many later commentators have suggested that his great height would have reminded the contemporary viewer of Jodocus Vijd's brother, also called Christopher
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece: The Holy Pilgrims

DESCRIPTION: The Erythraean and Cumaean Sibyls are related to the Annunciation through their prophecies.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece: Erythraean Sibyl

DESCRIPTION: The text on the floating ribbon refers to Virgil.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece: Erythraean Sibyl

DESCRIPTION: The Latin name of the Sibyl is indicated on the frame
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece: Erythraean Sibyl

DESCRIPTION: The angel and the Virgin of the Annunciation are separated by two small panels, one with the representation of an arched window looking out upon a city square, and the other with a wash basin and ewer set into a niche and a white towel hanging from a rail beside it
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Ghent Altarpiece: Niche with Wash Basin
TECHNIQUE: Oil on wood, 213,5 x 36,1 cm (with Sibyl)

DESCRIPTION: "The Arnolfini Marriage" is a name that has been given to this untitled double portrait by Jan van Eyck, now in the National Gallery, London.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: Portrait of Giovanni Arnolfini and his Wife

DESCRIPTION: It is one of the greatest celebrations of human mutuality.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: Portrait of Giovanni Arnolfini and his Wife

DESCRIPTION: Like Rembrandt's "Jewish Bride", this painting reveals to us the inner meaning of a true marriage.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: Portrait of Giovanni Arnolfini and his Wife

DESCRIPTION: Giovanni Arnolfini, a prosperous Italian banker who had settled in Bruges, and his wife Giovanna Cenami, stand side by side in the bridal chamber, facing towards the viewer.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: Portrait of Giovanni Arnolfini and his Wife

DESCRIPTION: The husband is holding out his wife's hand.Despite the restricted space, the painter has contrived to surround them with a host of symbols.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: Portrait of Giovanni Arnolfini and his Wife

DESCRIPTION: To the left, the oranges placed on the low table and the windowsill are a reminder of an original innocence, of an age before sin.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: Portrait of Giovanni Arnolfini and his Wife

DESCRIPTION: Unless, that is, they are not in fact oranges but apples (it is difficult to be certain), in which case they would represent the temptation of knowledge and the Fall.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: Portrait of Giovanni Arnolfini and his Wife

DESCRIPTION: Above the couple's heads, the candle that has been left burning in broad daylight on one of the branches of an ornate copper chandelier can be interpreted as the nuptial flame, or as the eye of God.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: Portrait of Giovanni Arnolfini and his Wife

DESCRIPTION: The small dog in the foreground is an emblem of fidelity and love.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: Portrait of Giovanni Arnolfini and his Wife

DESCRIPTION: Meanwhile, the marriage bed with its bright red curtains evokes the physical act of love which, according to Christian doctrine, is an essential part of the perfect union of man and wife.Although all these different elements are highly charged with meaning, they are of secondary importance compared to the mirror, the focal point of the whole composition.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: Portrait of Giovanni Arnolfini and his Wife

DESCRIPTION: It has often been noted that two tiny figures can be seen reflected in it, their image captured as they cross the threshold of the room.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: Portrait of Giovanni Arnolfini and his Wife

DESCRIPTION: They are the painter himself and a young man, doubtless arriving to act as witnesses to the marriage.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: Portrait of Giovanni Arnolfini and his Wife

DESCRIPTION: The essential point, however, is the fact that the convex mirror is able to absorb and reflect in a single image both the floor and the ceiling of the room, as well as the sky and the garden outside, both of which are otherwise barely visible through the side window.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: Portrait of Giovanni Arnolfini and his Wife

DESCRIPTION: The mirror thus acts as a sort of hole in the texture of space.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: Portrait of Giovanni Arnolfini and his Wife

DESCRIPTION: It sucks the entire visual world into itself, transforming it into a representation.The cubic space in which the Arnolfinis stand is itself a prefiguration of the techniques of perspective which were still to come.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: Portrait of Giovanni Arnolfini and his Wife

DESCRIPTION: Van Eyck practised perspective on a purely heuristic basis, unaware of the laws by which it was governed.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: Portrait of Giovanni Arnolfini and his Wife

DESCRIPTION: In this picture, he uses the mirror precisely in order to explode the limits of the space to which his technique gives him access as soon as it threatens to limit him
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: Portrait of Giovanni Arnolfini and his Wife

DESCRIPTION: Here the visual and thematic elements are similar to those of the Chancellor Rolin Madonna.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Madonna with Canon van der Paele

DESCRIPTION: Van Eyck is concerned with showing the presence of a vision and therefore of illustrating the reality of God in our world.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Madonna with Canon van der Paele

DESCRIPTION: Just as Nicolas Rolin is shown in his palace, in the midst of an identifiable environment that seems to make his vision of the Virgin all the more real, so Canon van der Paele is shown in the choir of the collegiate church of St.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Madonna with Canon van der Paele

DESCRIPTION: Donatian in Bruges, where he is being presented to the Virgin by St.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Madonna with Canon van der Paele

DESCRIPTION: George and St.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Madonna with Canon van der Paele

DESCRIPTION: Donatian.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Madonna with Canon van der Paele

DESCRIPTION: Hans Belting is of the opinion that this picture once hung in the choir of the now destroyed church.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Madonna with Canon van der Paele

DESCRIPTION: This would mean that the depicted location mirrored the real location.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Madonna with Canon van der Paele

DESCRIPTION: Van der Paele would therefore have been able to see himself in the very place of his depicted vision and so "prove" to the world at large the reality of his divine experience.The exquisite brocades, furs, and silks are shown in an extraordinarily lifelike and brilliant way, a way that confirms their reality, their tangibility.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Madonna with Canon van der Paele

DESCRIPTION: On the other hand, the reliefs and sculptures on the capitals in the background and on the Virgin's throne all allude to Christ's salvation of humanity.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Madonna with Canon van der Paele

DESCRIPTION: The depictions on the throne of Adam and Eve, Cain killing Abel, and Samson fighting the lion, together with the depiction on the capitals of Abraham sacrificing Isaac, create an Old Testament framework which allows the observer to reflect on the mercy of God, who sent his son, Christ the Redeemer, into the world.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Madonna with Canon van der Paele

DESCRIPTION: Redemption from sin (Cain killing his brother) is possible only through the power of faith (Samson overpowering the lion).
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Madonna with Canon van der Paele

DESCRIPTION: The goodness and grace of God "at the moment of truth" (Abraham sacrificing Isaac) serves as proof of the redeeming power and presence of servants of God both celestial (St.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Madonna with Canon van der Paele

DESCRIPTION: George) and mortal (Canon van der Paele).This is how van der Paele might have expressed the message of the painting-that paradise was at hand-a message confirmed by its being set in a very real but also sacred context.
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Madonna with Canon van der Paele

DESCRIPTION: The Virgin is pictures holding a nosegay and her son a parrot - unmistakable echoes of the Garden of Eden - and both figures have turned to face the meditating canon
AUTHOR: EYCK, Jan van
TITLE: The Madonna with Canon van der Paele

DESCRIPTION: In the background of this picture the city of Frankfurt am Main is depicted with a bird's eye perspective.
AUTHOR: FABER VON CREUZNACH, Conrad
TITLE: Gilbrecht von Holzhausen the Younger

DESCRIPTION: This makes the picture one of the earliest known depiction of the city.The pendant of this painting depicts Anna Holzhausen née Ratzeburg, the wife of the sitter
AUTHOR: FABER VON CREUZNACH, Conrad
TITLE: Gilbrecht von Holzhausen the Younger

DESCRIPTION: This painting is a copy after Conrad Faber von Creuznach's painting, now in the Musées Royaux des Beaux-Arts, Brussels.
AUTHOR: FABER VON CREUZNACH, Conrad
TITLE: Heinrich von Rhein zum Mohren
TECHNIQUE: Oil on oak panel, 54 x 38 cm

DESCRIPTION: It is debated whether it is an autograph replica by the painter himself or the work of an anonymous copyist.
AUTHOR: FABER VON CREUZNACH, Conrad
TITLE: Heinrich von Rhein zum Mohren
TECHNIQUE: Oil on oak panel, 54 x 38 cm

DESCRIPTION: It is probably by a copyist.The bearded sitter in this portrait rests his arms on a stone parapet and holds a rosary with a pomander attached.
AUTHOR: FABER VON CREUZNACH, Conrad
TITLE: Heinrich von Rhein zum Mohren
TECHNIQUE: Oil on oak panel, 54 x 38 cm

DESCRIPTION: He wears a broad-rimmed hat over a gold cap, a fur coat over a black shirt and white undershirt, and a gold ring on the left index finger.
AUTHOR: FABER VON CREUZNACH, Conrad
TITLE: Heinrich von Rhein zum Mohren
TECHNIQUE: Oil on oak panel, 54 x 38 cm

DESCRIPTION: In the background at left, a bridge over a lake leads to a rocky outcropping topped by a castle; on the right there is a house near a winding road, and fortifications at the edge of the lake are connected to an island by a bridge
AUTHOR: FABER VON CREUZNACH, Conrad
TITLE: Heinrich von Rhein zum Mohren
TECHNIQUE: Oil on oak panel, 54 x 38 cm

DESCRIPTION: Vittorio Alfieri (1749-1803)was an Italian tragic poet whose predominant theme was the overthrow of tyranny.To glorify the personality of this writer of tragedies, Fabre has clearly added to the faithfulness of the portrait a heroic tone, evident in the facial expression and the pose of the raised arm over which the brown mantle is slung all'antica.Beyond its value as a historical document, the work is also a striking example of the more severely classicistic current which emerged from the school of David, of whom Fabre was a pupil and close follower.The painting is signed and dated in the lower right corner, "F. X. Fabre Florentia 1793", and on the reverse bears a famous sonnet written by the poet, dated 18 August 1794
AUTHOR: FABRE, François-Xavier
TITLE: Portrait of Vittorio Alfieri

DESCRIPTION: In astronomy, the zodiac is the ring of constellations that lines the ecliptic, which is the apparent path of the Sun across the sky over the course of the year.
AUTHOR: FALCONETTO, Giovanni Maria
TITLE: Sign of Capricorn

DESCRIPTION: The twelve signs of the zodiac are the following:Aries (The Ram)Taurus (The Bull)Gemini (The Twins)Cancer (The Crab)Leo (The Lion)Virgo (The Virgin)Libra (The Scales)Scorpio (The Scorpion)Sagittarius (The Archer)Capricorn (The Sea-Goat)Aquarius (The Water Bearer)Pisces (The Fishes
AUTHOR: FALCONETTO, Giovanni Maria
TITLE: Sign of Capricorn

DESCRIPTION: The decoration in the camerone is attributed to Fasolo, with a contribution by Zelotti.
AUTHOR: FASOLO, Giovanni Antonio
TITLE: East wall of the camerone

DESCRIPTION: Here, inserted within elegant Corinthian loggias on the long wall, are four scenes taken from Roman history: Mucius Scaevola before Porsena and Sofonisba Asking Massinissa for Mercy (east wall), Scipio Returning Lucius's Betrothed and the Banquet of Antony and Cleopatra (west wall).
AUTHOR: FASOLO, Giovanni Antonio
TITLE: East wall of the camerone

DESCRIPTION: On either side of the fireplace the figures of Vulcan and Venus Holding Cupid, and above the door, the figures of Minerva and Mercury complete the decoration.The present picture shows the east wall
AUTHOR: FASOLO, Giovanni Antonio
TITLE: East wall of the camerone

DESCRIPTION: In the Villa da Porto, the artist placed his ancient historical events on a spatial plane that corresponds entirely to that of the viewer.
AUTHOR: FASOLO, Giovanni Antonio
TITLE: East wall of the camerone

DESCRIPTION: He thereby underscored with the actors' clothing, which is sometimes contemporary and sometimes ancient, that the moral example depicted here should be applied to everyone.The represented scenes on this wall are Sofonisba before Masinissa and Mucius Scaevola
AUTHOR: FASOLO, Giovanni Antonio
TITLE: East wall of the camerone

DESCRIPTION: This painting, painted in Munich in 1894 but later modified, is generally considered as a symbolic self-portrait, closely connected with the self-portrait of 1893, also painted in Munich
AUTHOR: FERENCZY, Károly
TITLE: Adam

DESCRIPTION: According to the Bible, the older brothers who were jealous of their father's love sell Joseph to the Ishmailites (Book IV of the Old Testament).
AUTHOR: FERENCZY, Károly
TITLE: Joseph Sold into Slavery by his Brothers

DESCRIPTION: The picture  shows the most tragic scene of the betrayal.
AUTHOR: FERENCZY, Károly
TITLE: Joseph Sold into Slavery by his Brothers

DESCRIPTION: Joseph, stripped to the waist, is seized and led to the merchants in white burnous who have just arrived.
AUTHOR: FERENCZY, Károly
TITLE: Joseph Sold into Slavery by his Brothers

DESCRIPTION: Ferenczy's picture, which is the largest of all in size, opens prospects: in the background of the scene  there is a huge plain area with figures lining up in the foreground.
AUTHOR: FERENCZY, Károly
TITLE: Joseph Sold into Slavery by his Brothers

DESCRIPTION: It is not necessary to know the biblical story to understand what is going on.
AUTHOR: FERENCZY, Károly
TITLE: Joseph Sold into Slavery by his Brothers

DESCRIPTION: The foreground is divided according to  colours and forms (dark skinned people and figures wearing white mantles) which find their counterpoints in peaceful blue and brown patches of the background.
AUTHOR: FERENCZY, Károly
TITLE: Joseph Sold into Slavery by his Brothers

DESCRIPTION: The background and the sunset making colours brighter unite the composition with Joseph and a man in a luxurious mantle in the middle who rises to the same level of importance as Joseph is because of the golden mantle complementing the blue of the sky and the river.The picture was painted from beginning to end in the open air, as it is known from Valér's letter to his father, the size of the picture must have presented a lot of technical problems.
AUTHOR: FERENCZY, Károly
TITLE: Joseph Sold into Slavery by his Brothers

DESCRIPTION: The model who posed for Joseph was Valér
AUTHOR: FERENCZY, Károly
TITLE: Joseph Sold into Slavery by his Brothers

DESCRIPTION: The laid table with armchairs around it in the garden of the Ferenczy family often appeared in  Ferenczy's pictures ("Sunny Evening", 1904, "Sunny Morning", 1905, and "The Prodigal Son", 1908).
AUTHOR: FERENCZY, Károly
TITLE: Sunny Morning

DESCRIPTION: "Sunny Morning", like "October", showed an idyllic scene in a little town.
AUTHOR: FERENCZY, Károly
TITLE: Sunny Morning

DESCRIPTION: Ferenczy views the bright and  peaceful subject not as a humorous one, his considerations as artist make his pictures more than mere genre pictures.
AUTHOR: FERENCZY, Károly
TITLE: Sunny Morning

DESCRIPTION: The morning sunshine penetrates under the branches of the walnut tree.
AUTHOR: FERENCZY, Károly
TITLE: Sunny Morning

DESCRIPTION: Eyes are drawn to the table with white table cloth.
AUTHOR: FERENCZY, Károly
TITLE: Sunny Morning

DESCRIPTION: Shadows of objects (a fruit basket, apples and a blue carafe) are projected on it, together with the delicate shadow of the basket chair which is not in the picture.
AUTHOR: FERENCZY, Károly
TITLE: Sunny Morning

DESCRIPTION: The natural posture  of people sitting around the table is a part  of  the arrangement.
AUTHOR: FERENCZY, Károly
TITLE: Sunny Morning

DESCRIPTION: The edge of the table running diagonally is accentuated by the arm and trunk of the female figure who is leaning back in the armchair and by the borderline between light and shadow on the leaves.Ferenczy's composition at this time was characterized by István Réti as follows: "... he places his figures into narrow space and full figures.
AUTHOR: FERENCZY, Károly
TITLE: Sunny Morning

DESCRIPTION: It is carefully decided on the basis of proportions and patches how much of them should be portrayed.
AUTHOR: FERENCZY, Károly
TITLE: Sunny Morning

DESCRIPTION: Proportion of space is shifted towards figures, what does not diminish the importance of  atmospheres in the pictures ...".
AUTHOR: FERENCZY, Károly
TITLE: Sunny Morning

DESCRIPTION: The contrast of surfaces in light and shadow is definite.
AUTHOR: FERENCZY, Károly
TITLE: Sunny Morning

DESCRIPTION: The way he painted the warm colours of faces which are in the shadow of hats is simply superb, just like the grey silk dress.
AUTHOR: FERENCZY, Károly
TITLE: Sunny Morning

DESCRIPTION: Ferenczy's style of painting is more dynamic and delicate coloured at the same, mow that he gave up his previous plain style
AUTHOR: FERENCZY, Károly
TITLE: Sunny Morning

DESCRIPTION: The portrait represents the painter's three children, his son Valér (1885-1954), painter and graphic artist, and the twins Béni (1890-1967), painter and graphic artist and Noémi (1890-1957), a painter who established tapestry in Hungary
AUTHOR: FERENCZY, Károly
TITLE: Triple Portrait (Sister and Brothers)

DESCRIPTION: The Adoration of the Magi, is one of the fourteen panels from the altarpiece of the Chancel in Viseu Cathedral, and the earliest dated work of the artist.
AUTHOR: FERNANDES, Vasco
TITLE: Adoration of the Magi

DESCRIPTION: It  is a key work in the evaluation of the impact which the painting and the painters from southern parts of the Low Countries had on the taste of patrons and on the work of painters in Portugal.
AUTHOR: FERNANDES, Vasco
TITLE: Adoration of the Magi

DESCRIPTION: Despite the controversy surrounding its authorship, everything points to a team, led by the Flemish painter Francisco Henriques, joined locally by the young Vasco Fernandes, elaborating the altarpiece for the bishop of Viseu.The Adoration of the Magi includes iconographic details which confirm that the altarpiece was made locally.
AUTHOR: FERNANDES, Vasco
TITLE: Adoration of the Magi

DESCRIPTION: The black Wise King, Balthasar, is replaced by an Indian from Brazil.
AUTHOR: FERNANDES, Vasco
TITLE: Adoration of the Magi

DESCRIPTION: The closeness in time of this artistic representation (the first in Western art) to the discovery of the lands of the True Cross (Brazil) gives it an extraordinary historical value
AUTHOR: FERNANDES, Vasco
TITLE: Adoration of the Magi

DESCRIPTION: Gaudenzio Ferrari was one of Leonardo's many followers in Lombardy.
AUTHOR: FERRARI, Gaudenzio
TITLE: St Cecile with the Donator and St Marguerite
TECHNIQUE: Oil on wood, 121 x 52 and 120 x 49 cm, respectively

DESCRIPTION: These paintings were executed for the St Marguerite Chapel of the Santa Maria delle Grazie in Varallo.
AUTHOR: FERRARI, Gaudenzio
TITLE: St Cecile with the Donator and St Marguerite
TECHNIQUE: Oil on wood, 121 x 52 and 120 x 49 cm, respectively

DESCRIPTION: St Cecile is depicted with her attribute, a musical instrument (organ)

TITLE: St Cecile with the Donator and St Marguerite
TECHNIQUE: Oil on wood, 121 x 52 and 120 x 49 cm, respectively

DESCRIPTION: This monumental altar includes many parts that were exquisitely drawn and delicately expressed
AUTHOR: FERRARI, Gaudenzio
TITLE: Polyptych

DESCRIPTION: In composition and overall approach to subject matter Giovanni Andrea appears to have been influenced by Caravaggio's canvas of the same subject.
AUTHOR: FERRARI, Giovanni Andrea de
TITLE: Martha and Mary Magdalene

DESCRIPTION: However, while Caravaggio's composition is underpinned by a complex visual and literal tradition associated with this subject, Giovanni Andrea's interpretation appears to be more closely associated with allegorical genre scenes by Venetian masters, such as Titian or Palma Vecchio.
AUTHOR: FERRARI, Giovanni Andrea de
TITLE: Martha and Mary Magdalene

DESCRIPTION: Such influence could only have been transmuted into Giovanni Andrea's work through his most influential master, Bernardo Strozzi.
AUTHOR: FERRARI, Giovanni Andrea de
TITLE: Martha and Mary Magdalene

DESCRIPTION: Several borrowings from Strozzi are apparent in the present work
AUTHOR: FERRARI, Giovanni Andrea de
TITLE: Martha and Mary Magdalene

DESCRIPTION: The present portrait study of a woman, bust-length, wearing roses in her hair, was executed after the artist's return to Padua and after his frescoes for the Villa Selvatico Emo-Capodilista in Battaglia Terme
AUTHOR: FERRARI, Luca
TITLE: Study of a Woman

DESCRIPTION: According to legend, Leander, a youth of Abydos, a town on the Asian shore of the Hellespont, used to swim across the waters at night to Sestos on the opposite side to meet his lover Hero, a priestess of Aphrodite.
AUTHOR: FETTI, Domenico
TITLE: Hero and Leander

DESCRIPTION: She would guide him by holding up a lighted torch.
AUTHOR: FETTI, Domenico
TITLE: Hero and Leander

DESCRIPTION: One stormy night Leander was drowned.
AUTHOR: FETTI, Domenico
TITLE: Hero and Leander

DESCRIPTION: Hero in her despair threw herself into the sea.
AUTHOR: FETTI, Domenico
TITLE: Hero and Leander

DESCRIPTION: The story is related in this form by the Greek poet Museus (4th-5th cent.
AUTHOR: FETTI, Domenico
TITLE: Hero and Leander

DESCRIPTION: Ovid tells of the lovers, omitting their death.
AUTHOR: FETTI, Domenico
TITLE: Hero and Leander

DESCRIPTION: The theme is found in Italian and Netherlandish painting, especially of the 17th century: the drowned Oleander is borne away by Needs as Hero plunges to her death into the sea
AUTHOR: FETTI, Domenico
TITLE: Hero and Leander

DESCRIPTION: The image of this famous repentant sinner, prototype of the penitent in Christian art, became one of the favourite subjects of European art in the sixteenth and seventeenth centuries.In a career that spanned only thirteen years, Fetti's work underwent an astonishing evolution, from objective realism to lyricism, from compact form to the erosion of space, from solid and plastic modeling to a broken and agitated kind of painting, from descriptive to tortuous brush strokes, from dry to oily and liquid tints, from local colour to tonality, and from analytical concreteness to a sweetly sentimental air.
AUTHOR: FETTI, Domenico
TITLE: The Repentant St Mary Magdalene

DESCRIPTION: Here the artist takes his inspiration from Correggio's Mary Magdalene reading.
AUTHOR: FETTI, Domenico
TITLE: The Repentant St Mary Magdalene

DESCRIPTION: He represents the sensual and seductive heroine with half-closed eyes, lowered head, and the characteristic gesture of the hand on which she rests her head, with an intensely melancholic significance, equivalent to 'tristitia'.
AUTHOR: FETTI, Domenico
TITLE: The Repentant St Mary Magdalene

DESCRIPTION: In fact the painter conceived this theme in terms of a Meditation or Melancholy.It is worth remembering that Giovan Battista Andreini's drama Maddalena was published in Mantua in 1617, and may have provided the idea for the painting.
AUTHOR: FETTI, Domenico
TITLE: The Repentant St Mary Magdalene

DESCRIPTION: In any case, the last possible date for its execution is 1621, the date on which a copy (now at Hampton Court), possibly the work of the painter's sister Lucrina Fetti, was delivered to Ferdinando Gonzaga
AUTHOR: FETTI, Domenico
TITLE: The Repentant St Mary Magdalene

DESCRIPTION: The painting is signed on the crest of the helmet: "JO AMBROSIUS FIGINUS P."
AUTHOR: FIGINO, Giovanni Ambrogio
TITLE: Portrait of Lucio Foppa

DESCRIPTION: It is not certain that the subject is really the Field Marshal Lucio Foppa, about whom there is little documentation.The only remaining example of the genre of painting for which Figino was famous among his contemporaries, this portrait also reveals the varied influences on the artist.
AUTHOR: FIGINO, Giovanni Ambrogio
TITLE: Portrait of Lucio Foppa

DESCRIPTION: Although it shows reminiscences of Flemish painting, the portrait is more openly "cavalier," with the noble subject posed as if on a stage.
AUTHOR: FIGINO, Giovanni Ambrogio
TITLE: Portrait of Lucio Foppa

DESCRIPTION: The composition plays on the contrast between the closed profile on the right and the open one on the left.
AUTHOR: FIGINO, Giovanni Ambrogio
TITLE: Portrait of Lucio Foppa

DESCRIPTION: The latter relates to the decorative details of the chiseled helmet, the flowers and the feathers, which are all touched by incisive highlights.
AUTHOR: FIGINO, Giovanni Ambrogio
TITLE: Portrait of Lucio Foppa

DESCRIPTION: Notations of light also appear on the lace of the collar and the sleeves, which correspond to the flowers and fruit on the table.
AUTHOR: FIGINO, Giovanni Ambrogio
TITLE: Portrait of Lucio Foppa

DESCRIPTION: Daring contrasts mark the dramatic colour range of blues, reds, and yellows
AUTHOR: FIGINO, Giovanni Ambrogio
TITLE: Portrait of Lucio Foppa

DESCRIPTION: The painting shows a still-life with a dish of oysters upon a brazier, an artichoke in a dish resting upon a loaf of bread, together with a cooked capon and a knife, fork and slices of bread on plates and a silver condiment dish upon a table top.
AUTHOR: FLEGEL, Georg
TITLE: Still-Life
TECHNIQUE: Oil on copper beech panel, 33 x 50 cm

DESCRIPTION: Some of the elements of the still-life, such as the salt or condiment dish, with its distinctive sphinx feet, can be found in other still-lifes of the painter.The subdued tonality and the distinctively low key palette are typical of Flegel's maturity in the late 1620s and 1630s, as is the use of a panel made from copper beech
AUTHOR: FLEGEL, Georg
TITLE: Still-Life
TECHNIQUE: Oil on copper beech panel, 33 x 50 cm

DESCRIPTION: Gerard Pietersz.
AUTHOR: FLINCK, Govert Teunisz.
TITLE: Portrait of Gerard Pietersz. Hulft

DESCRIPTION: Hulft (1621-1656) was First Councillor and Director-general of the VOC (Dutch East India Company).
AUTHOR: FLINCK, Govert Teunisz.
TITLE: Portrait of Gerard Pietersz. Hulft

DESCRIPTION: The portrait within the painted frame is typical of Flinck's style in the 1650s.
AUTHOR: FLINCK, Govert Teunisz.
TITLE: Portrait of Gerard Pietersz. Hulft

DESCRIPTION: By then he had largely abandoned a Rembrandtesque style in favour of a brighter manner of painting inspired by Van Dyck.
AUTHOR: FLINCK, Govert Teunisz.
TITLE: Portrait of Gerard Pietersz. Hulft

DESCRIPTION: The still-life surrounding the portrait is unique in Flinck's portrait oeuvre
AUTHOR: FLINCK, Govert Teunisz.
TITLE: Portrait of Gerard Pietersz. Hulft

DESCRIPTION: In this large, but still sketchlike panel, the goddess of love waits while her husband forges the armour for Achilles's Trojan conquest.
AUTHOR: FLORIS, Frans
TITLE: Venus at Vulcan's Forge

DESCRIPTION: The broken-winged, serpent-entwined lance on the ground refers to the caduceus of Mercury, Cupid's father.
AUTHOR: FLORIS, Frans
TITLE: Venus at Vulcan's Forge

DESCRIPTION: The free brushwork and breadth of his Italianate pictorialism make Floris parent to generations of Northern artists.
AUTHOR: FLORIS, Frans
TITLE: Venus at Vulcan's Forge

DESCRIPTION: All his figures share a painterly freedom and grandeur that proved a harbinger of Rubens
AUTHOR: FLORIS, Frans
TITLE: Venus at Vulcan's Forge

DESCRIPTION: In this landscape the influence of Luca Carlevarijs, Marco Ricci and Tempesta can be observed.
AUTHOR: FLURER, Franz Ignaz
TITLE: Seacoast with Travellers and a Town

DESCRIPTION: The staffage figures, people and animals recall the Roman 17th-century bamboccianti
AUTHOR: FLURER, Franz Ignaz
TITLE: Seacoast with Travellers and a Town

DESCRIPTION: The identity of the sitter, portrayed holding a letter next to a writing desk with an inkwell and pen, is unknown.
AUTHOR: FONTANA, Lavinia
TITLE: Portrait of a Notary

DESCRIPTION: The austere formatting and the compositive rigour belong to the portraiture type Fontana developed.The painting is signed and dated: LAVINIA FONTANA DE / ZAPPIS FACIEBAT / MDLXXXIII.
AUTHOR: FONTANA, Lavinia
TITLE: Portrait of a Notary

DESCRIPTION: As was customary, Fontana linked her husband last name (Zappi) to her own
AUTHOR: FONTANA, Lavinia
TITLE: Portrait of a Notary

DESCRIPTION: The figure types of the painting are based on Roman and Tuscan models, which derive principally from the work of Giorgio Vasari and Perino del Vaga
AUTHOR: FONTANA, Prospero
TITLE: Holy Family with the Infant St John the Baptist

DESCRIPTION: The Villa Zenobio in Santa Bona Nuova, near Treviso, was built between 1673 and 1689 and was profoundly reworked during the mid-eighteenth century when the garden wing was erected.
AUTHOR: FONTEBASSO, Francesco
TITLE: View of the ballroom

DESCRIPTION: The small entrance portego was decorated in the early years of the eighteenth century by Gregorio Lazzarini.
AUTHOR: FONTEBASSO, Francesco
TITLE: View of the ballroom

DESCRIPTION: In 1744, the villa was acquired by Sebastiano Uccelli (1695-1768) who can be credited with the renovation of the villa.
AUTHOR: FONTEBASSO, Francesco
TITLE: View of the ballroom

DESCRIPTION: He commissioned Francesco Fontebasso to paint frescoes in the ballroom of the new garden wing.Frescoes unfold across the ceiling and walls of the vast ballroom, as well as beneath the open gallery.
AUTHOR: FONTEBASSO, Francesco
TITLE: View of the ballroom

DESCRIPTION: The ceiling fresco depicts The Magnanimity of Scipio, while the wall frescoes focus on the narration of episodes from the life of Queen Zenobia and represent The Banquet of Zenobia and Triumph of Aureliano.
AUTHOR: FONTEBASSO, Francesco
TITLE: View of the ballroom

DESCRIPTION: However, the interpretation of these scenes is debated
AUTHOR: FONTEBASSO, Francesco
TITLE: View of the ballroom

DESCRIPTION: Frescoes unfold across the ceiling and walls of the vast ballroom, as well as beneath the open gallery.
AUTHOR: FONTEBASSO, Francesco
TITLE: The Magnanimity of Scipio

DESCRIPTION: The ceiling fresco depicts The Magnanimity of Scipio
AUTHOR: FONTEBASSO, Francesco
TITLE: The Magnanimity of Scipio

DESCRIPTION: Completing the decoration are some other images that are not connected to the subject of the principal sections.
AUTHOR: FONTEBASSO, Francesco
TITLE: Supplemental scene

DESCRIPTION: Faux colonnades that reveal glimpses of imposing classical buildings frame a variety of figures, The present picture shows a soldier conversing with a dwarf jester dressed in elegant livery, who holds a small dog
AUTHOR: FONTEBASSO, Francesco
TITLE: Supplemental scene

DESCRIPTION: This fresco is on the ceiling above the monumental stairway in Palazzo Bernardi.
AUTHOR: FONTEBASSO, Francesco
TITLE: Ceiling decoration

DESCRIPTION: The fresco shows groups of musicians, pages, and servants at an illusionistic balustrade turning to greet the guests
AUTHOR: FONTEBASSO, Francesco
TITLE: Ceiling decoration

DESCRIPTION: Formerly in Santa Maria delle Grazie at Bergamo, it was removed to the Brera in 1811.
AUTHOR: FOPPA, Vincenzo
TITLE: Altarpiece

DESCRIPTION: The predella and the crowning panel were acquired from the Albani collection in 1811.
AUTHOR: FOPPA, Vincenzo
TITLE: Altarpiece

DESCRIPTION: It is not certain that the predella and the crowning element originally formed part of the same altarpiece; and the accuracy of the entire reconstruction is in doubt.
AUTHOR: FOPPA, Vincenzo
TITLE: Altarpiece

DESCRIPTION: The panels are the following:Central panel: Madonna and Child (165 x 80 cm); side panels: Sts Jerome, Alexander, Vincent, Anthony (137 x 39 cm each); upper side panels: Sts Clare, Bonaventura, Louis, Bernardino (126 x 40 cm each); upper centralaa panel: St Francis (128 x 82 cm); predella panels showing scenes from the Life of Christ (87 x 30 cm each) and two Angels in Adoration (27 x 29 cm each).This altarpiece belongs to Foppa's early stylistic maturity and retains the archaising tendency toward simplification of his youthful period, before he was influenced by Leonardo and Bramante.
AUTHOR: FOPPA, Vincenzo
TITLE: Altarpiece

DESCRIPTION: It also shows the pungent impetuosity of Mantegna's influence in the sharply drawn perspective, and in the tension and almost metallic consistency of the forms.
AUTHOR: FOPPA, Vincenzo
TITLE: Altarpiece

DESCRIPTION: In this resplendent altarpiece, the central panels are particularly fine examples of Foppa's masterly interweaving of colour and light.
AUTHOR: FOPPA, Vincenzo
TITLE: Altarpiece

DESCRIPTION: The Madonna's face, lightly thrown into relief, concludes a series of circling motifs enhanced by the elegant twist of the body of the Child, as he leans over to pluck the string of the lute.
AUTHOR: FOPPA, Vincenzo
TITLE: Altarpiece

DESCRIPTION: In the panel above, St Francis appears as a motionless, somewhat astonished figure immersed in the limpid air of a lyric landscape
AUTHOR: FOPPA, Vincenzo
TITLE: Altarpiece

DESCRIPTION: This is a fragmentary portrait of an elderly man, probably painted late in Foppa's career.
AUTHOR: FOPPA, Vincenzo
TITLE: Portrait of an Elderly Gentleman

DESCRIPTION: The sitter's costume and his dignified appearance suggest that he was a highly placed member of Lombard society.The panel, formerly attributed to Ambrogio de Predis, was cut on all three sides save the upper edge, and painted additions were added at right and bottom in the nineteenth century
AUTHOR: FOPPA, Vincenzo
TITLE: Portrait of an Elderly Gentleman

DESCRIPTION: This is the leftt wing of a diptych, originally located in Melun.
AUTHOR: FOUQUET, Jean
TITLE: Melun Diptych: Estienne Chevalier with St Stephen

DESCRIPTION: The right wing showing the Virgin and Child Surrounded by Angels is in the Koninklijk Museum voor Schone Kunsten, Antwerp.Estienne Chevalier, who came from Melun, was French Ambassador to England in 1445 and six years later became Treasurer to Charles VII of France.
AUTHOR: FOUQUET, Jean
TITLE: Melun Diptych: Estienne Chevalier with St Stephen

DESCRIPTION: He presented the diptych of which this panel forms the left wing, to his native town; on this wing he had himself painted next to his patron saint, Stephen.
AUTHOR: FOUQUET, Jean
TITLE: Melun Diptych: Estienne Chevalier with St Stephen

DESCRIPTION: The saint, wearing a deacon's robe, is holding a book, on which a jagged stone is lying, as a symbol of his martyrdom.
AUTHOR: FOUQUET, Jean
TITLE: Melun Diptych: Estienne Chevalier with St Stephen

DESCRIPTION: The formal architecture in the background is in the Italian Renaissance style showing pilasters with coloured inlaid marble panels between them.
AUTHOR: FOUQUET, Jean
TITLE: Melun Diptych: Estienne Chevalier with St Stephen

DESCRIPTION: On the wall, receding in perspective, the name Estienne Chevalier is inscribed several times.
AUTHOR: FOUQUET, Jean
TITLE: Melun Diptych: Estienne Chevalier with St Stephen

DESCRIPTION: Originally the donor and the saint were looking towards the Madonna, who occupied the right wing of the diptych; this panel found its way into the Antwerp Museum.According to a description of the paintings by Denis Godefroy in 1661, the original frames were covered in blue velvet.
AUTHOR: FOUQUET, Jean
TITLE: Melun Diptych: Estienne Chevalier with St Stephen

DESCRIPTION: Round each picture were strands of gold and silver thread, in which the donor's initials were woven in pearls.
AUTHOR: FOUQUET, Jean
TITLE: Melun Diptych: Estienne Chevalier with St Stephen

DESCRIPTION: There were also gilded medallions on which stories of the saints were represented.Tradition has it - and there is considerable supporting evidence - that the Madonna's features are those of Agnes Sorel, the beautiful and influential mistress of Charles VII.
AUTHOR: FOUQUET, Jean
TITLE: Melun Diptych: Estienne Chevalier with St Stephen

DESCRIPTION: Known portraits of her certainly do not conflict with this hypothesis.
AUTHOR: FOUQUET, Jean
TITLE: Melun Diptych: Estienne Chevalier with St Stephen

DESCRIPTION: Her relationship with Estienne Chevalier was not entirely political, and an eighteenth-century inscription on the back of the Antwerp panel tells us that the diptych of Melun was endowed by Estienne following a vow he made on her death in 1450.
AUTHOR: FOUQUET, Jean
TITLE: Melun Diptych: Estienne Chevalier with St Stephen

DESCRIPTION: The diptych was in the chancel of the Church of Notre-Dame at Melun, south of Paris, from 1461 until about 1775, when the two halves became separated.The date of Agnes Sorel's death is not the only reason for assuming that the diptych was painted around 1450.
AUTHOR: FOUQUET, Jean
TITLE: Melun Diptych: Estienne Chevalier with St Stephen

DESCRIPTION: At any later period the cut of Estienne's robe would no longer have been in fashion.
AUTHOR: FOUQUET, Jean
TITLE: Melun Diptych: Estienne Chevalier with St Stephen

DESCRIPTION: A few years earlier, between 1443 and 1447, Fouquet had been in Italy and the background of the Berlin panel is clearly the result of what he saw there.
AUTHOR: FOUQUET, Jean
TITLE: Melun Diptych: Estienne Chevalier with St Stephen

DESCRIPTION: After returning from the south, he settled in his birthplace, Tours.
AUTHOR: FOUQUET, Jean
TITLE: Melun Diptych: Estienne Chevalier with St Stephen

DESCRIPTION: From then on he worked for Charles VII and the court and became the leading exponent of the French Court style
AUTHOR: FOUQUET, Jean
TITLE: Melun Diptych: Estienne Chevalier with St Stephen

DESCRIPTION: This is the portrait of Fouquet's that most strongly reflects the spirit of the Renaissance.
AUTHOR: FOUQUET, Jean
TITLE: Portrait of Guillaume Jouvenel des Ursins

DESCRIPTION: The subject of the portrait was a powerful lord, the Chancellor of France of both Charles VII and Louis XI, one of the leading notabilities of France.
AUTHOR: FOUQUET, Jean
TITLE: Portrait of Guillaume Jouvenel des Ursins

DESCRIPTION: The background, composed of Renaissance architecture with lavish gilded panellings inlaid with marble fillings displays an Italian influence.
AUTHOR: FOUQUET, Jean
TITLE: Portrait of Guillaume Jouvenel des Ursins

DESCRIPTION: Against this background the monumental figure of the Chancellor kneels in prayer before a lectern, on which a great folio lies open on a cushion of red, white and yellow stripes.
AUTHOR: FOUQUET, Jean
TITLE: Portrait of Guillaume Jouvenel des Ursins

DESCRIPTION: The red of his robe, trimmed with brown fur at the neck and sleeves, is reflected in the heavy, fleshy face of the Chancellor, on his thin lips, and on the head, which combines an overall impression of strength, intelligence and extraordinary dignity.
AUTHOR: FOUQUET, Jean
TITLE: Portrait of Guillaume Jouvenel des Ursins

DESCRIPTION: The decorative harmony of the red and gold in which his head is framed only serves to enhance the imposing effect of the whole figure.
AUTHOR: FOUQUET, Jean
TITLE: Portrait of Guillaume Jouvenel des Ursins

DESCRIPTION: With this portrait Fouquet earns his place as a fit contemporary of the great masters of the Italian Quattrocento, Andrea Mantegna, Piero della Francesca and Antonello da Messina
AUTHOR: FOUQUET, Jean
TITLE: Portrait of Guillaume Jouvenel des Ursins

DESCRIPTION: The Hortus Palatinus next to Heidelberg set the tone for the development of the Baroque garden in Germany.
AUTHOR: FOUQUIER, Jacques
TITLE: Hortus Palatinus and Heidelberg Castle

DESCRIPTION: The Prince Elector Frederick V of the Palatinate hired the fFrench architect Salomon de Caus for this project.
AUTHOR: FOUQUIER, Jacques
TITLE: Hortus Palatinus and Heidelberg Castle

DESCRIPTION: hardly anything now remains of the garden itself, but engravings by the architect and the painting by Fouquier give some impression of the size  and the layout of the beds
AUTHOR: FOUQUIER, Jacques
TITLE: Hortus Palatinus and Heidelberg Castle

DESCRIPTION: This panel belongs to a body of more than 30 surviving paintings, made over a period of at least a decade, in which Fragonard reproduced the manner of seventeenth-century Dutch landscapes, especially those of Jacob van Ruisdael.
AUTHOR: FRAGONARD, Jean-Honoré
TITLE: Young Woman and a Herdsman in a Landscape

DESCRIPTION: There is also considerable evidence that some of these pictures were commissioned as pendants to seventeenth-century Dutch paintings
AUTHOR: FRAGONARD, Jean-Honoré
TITLE: Young Woman and a Herdsman in a Landscape

DESCRIPTION: One of several sentimental heads by Fragonard, comparable to some extent with those by Greuze, though more plausible and individual
AUTHOR: FRAGONARD, Jean-Honoré
TITLE: A Young Scholar

DESCRIPTION: At first sight, this painting describing the feminine resistance preceding abandon, might seem to belong to the same vein of light-hearted, erotic themes that Fragonard was fond of throughout his career.
AUTHOR: FRAGONARD, Jean-Honoré
TITLE: The Bolt

DESCRIPTION: However, the intensity of the chiaroscuro effects and the dramatic power of the diagonal composition, lend a certain gravity to the scene.Interestingly, this painting has a pendant illustrating sacred love, an Adoration of the Shepherds, also in the Louvre
AUTHOR: FRAGONARD, Jean-Honoré
TITLE: The Bolt

DESCRIPTION: This large painting was part of a series portraying all the Grand Dukes in official garb and with the insignia of office, once located in the Hospital of Santa Maria Nuova, Florence of which the Medici were patrons.
AUTHOR: FRANCESCHINI, Baldassarre
TITLE: Portrait of Grand Duke Cosimo III de' Medici

DESCRIPTION: The full-length portrait represents Cosimo III (1642-1723) holding the crown and sceptre and clothed in gold damask with an ermine cloak
AUTHOR: FRANCESCHINI, Baldassarre
TITLE: Portrait of Grand Duke Cosimo III de' Medici

DESCRIPTION: This scene depicts Crown Prince Cosimo II de' Medici Receiving the Victors from Bona in Front of the Church of San Stefano in Pisa (1606).
AUTHOR: FRANCESCHINI, Baldassarre
TITLE: History of the Medici

DESCRIPTION: It is part of the narrative cycle with scenes from the recent history of the Medici Volterrano painted in the portico of the inner courtyard in Villa Medicea La Petraia, near Florence
AUTHOR: FRANCESCHINI, Baldassarre
TITLE: History of the Medici

DESCRIPTION: This circular ceiling painting decorates one of the halls of the Liechtenstein Garden Palace at Rossau
AUTHOR: FRANCESCHINI, Marcantonio
TITLE: Aurora Abducting Cephalus

DESCRIPTION: This painting is the only known work of this artist.
AUTHOR: FRANCESCO DI GABRIELE DA VITERBO
TITLE: Madonna and Child Enthroned with Saints

DESCRIPTION: The represented saints are Sts Francis, Jerome, Catherine and Anthony.
AUTHOR: FRANCESCO DI GABRIELE DA VITERBO
TITLE: Madonna and Child Enthroned with Saints

DESCRIPTION: The panel is dated (Anno Domini MCCCCCIII XXVII JUNII) and signed (FRANCS..VS DE.
AUTHOR: FRANCESCO DI GABRIELE DA VITERBO
TITLE: Madonna and Child Enthroned with Saints

DESCRIPTION: GABRIELIS.
AUTHOR: FRANCESCO DI GABRIELE DA VITERBO
TITLE: Madonna and Child Enthroned with Saints

DESCRIPTION: DE.
AUTHOR: FRANCESCO DI GABRIELE DA VITERBO
TITLE: Madonna and Child Enthroned with Saints

DESCRIPTION: VITERBIO.

TITLE: Madonna and Child Enthroned with Saints

DESCRIPTION: PINXIT).
AUTHOR: FRANCESCO DI GABRIELE DA VITERBO
TITLE: Madonna and Child Enthroned with Saints

DESCRIPTION: This small panel, slighly larger than an illumination, is one of the first examples of the subject which Francesco di Giorgio repeatedly confronted.
AUTHOR: FRANCESCO DI GIORGIO MARTINI
TITLE: Nativity

DESCRIPTION: Francesco di Giorgio Martini was a multifaceted artist who embodied the spirit of Renaissance Humanism: an architect, sculpture, miniatur and painter.
AUTHOR: FRANCESCO DI GIORGIO MARTINI
TITLE: Madonna and Child with Two Angels

DESCRIPTION: He preferred to work as an architect and a designer of forfications, as in his work at Urbino, and he collaborated on the building of Siena cathedral.
AUTHOR: FRANCESCO DI GIORGIO MARTINI
TITLE: Madonna and Child with Two Angels

DESCRIPTION: He also wrote a treatise on civil and military architecture.His painted oeuvre is sporadic, and employs a soft and delicate style which may recall Botticelli, although some experts have seen the influence of Verrocchio in the lightness, grace and elegance of the poses, together with the high degree of finish
AUTHOR: FRANCESCO DI GIORGIO MARTINI
TITLE: Madonna and Child with Two Angels

DESCRIPTION: The Virgin is seated in the foreground, gently supporting the Child on her lap.
AUTHOR: FRANCESCO DI GIORGIO MARTINI
TITLE: Virgin and Child with St Catherine and Angels
TECHNIQUE: Mixed technique on panel, 62 x 42 cm

DESCRIPTION: Behind Him are placed four figures in front of a flat and undefined background of a striking red, which is decorated with a printed black design of curving tendrils.
AUTHOR: FRANCESCO DI GIORGIO MARTINI
TITLE: Virgin and Child with St Catherine and Angels
TECHNIQUE: Mixed technique on panel, 62 x 42 cm

DESCRIPTION: The artist's technical skill is evident in the transparency of the haloes, which are subtly painted as if they were fine lace.
AUTHOR: FRANCESCO DI GIORGIO MARTINI
TITLE: Virgin and Child with St Catherine and Angels
TECHNIQUE: Mixed technique on panel, 62 x 42 cm

DESCRIPTION: Notable are the modelling of the hands and faces, and the lyrical poses of the Virgin and Child and the background figures
AUTHOR: FRANCESCO DI GIORGIO MARTINI
TITLE: Virgin and Child with St Catherine and Angels
TECHNIQUE: Mixed technique on panel, 62 x 42 cm

DESCRIPTION: The popularity of Francia's paintings arises from their very individual expression of harmony, both in content and form.
AUTHOR: FRANCIA, Francesco
TITLE: Madonna and Saints

DESCRIPTION: This is evoked by his simple arrangements of figures, usually parallel with the picture surface in the immediate foreground and the tender, almost sentimental expression of his Madonnas and saints.
AUTHOR: FRANCIA, Francesco
TITLE: Madonna and Saints

DESCRIPTION: The painting technique with the smooth treatment of the surface conforms with this style
AUTHOR: FRANCIA, Francesco
TITLE: Madonna and Saints

DESCRIPTION: Scene 4 of the Cecilia cycle in the Oratory of St Cecilia, painted by an unidentified collaborator of Francesco Francia, shows the angel, now visible to Valerian as well, placing wreath of flowers from paradise on the heads of the bride and groom.
AUTHOR: FRANCIA, Francesco
TITLE: Legend of Sts Cecilia and Valerian, Scene 4

DESCRIPTION: The angels offers to grant Valerian one wish, and Valerian asks that his brother Tiburtius might also convert to Christianity.
AUTHOR: FRANCIA, Francesco
TITLE: Legend of Sts Cecilia and Valerian, Scene 4

DESCRIPTION: The scene to the left in the middle distance depicts the discussion between Valerian, Tiburtius, and Cecilia about Christ's Passion and his earthly succession - a discussion that took place before Tiburtius received baptism.
AUTHOR: FRANCIA, Francesco
TITLE: Legend of Sts Cecilia and Valerian, Scene 4

DESCRIPTION: To the right in the background the brother has sought out the pope as well, and is saved
AUTHOR: FRANCIA, Francesco
TITLE: Legend of Sts Cecilia and Valerian, Scene 4

DESCRIPTION: This portrait, showing an elegantly dressed gentlemen, reveals the general tendency towards a psychological approach in portraits, found most markedly in the portraits of Lorenzo Lotto
AUTHOR: FRANCIABIGIO
TITLE: Portrait of a Man

DESCRIPTION: Ambrosius Francken was a member of the second generation of the family of painters in Antwerp.
AUTHOR: FRANCKEN, Ambrosius I
TITLE: Descent from the Cross

DESCRIPTION: He was a Mannerist, and like other painters in the Low Countries in the last third of the 16th century, he became eclectic, a trend which itinerant Netherlandish artists of international culture helped to establish.
AUTHOR: FRANCKEN, Ambrosius I
TITLE: Descent from the Cross

DESCRIPTION: His art was somewhat artificial, and his agitated style never achieved true pathos.This panel was painted 25 years before Rubens' Descent from the Cross, also in the Antwerp Cathedral.
AUTHOR: FRANCKEN, Ambrosius I
TITLE: Descent from the Cross

DESCRIPTION: A simple comparison of the two works speaks about the artistic development that took place that short space of time, due not least to Rubens' own special genius
AUTHOR: FRANCKEN, Ambrosius I
TITLE: Descent from the Cross

DESCRIPTION: Following the restoration of Spanish rule and Catholic worship in Antwerp in 1585, the city fathers ordered the crafts and guilds to reinstall their altars in the Cathedral.
AUTHOR: FRANCKEN, Frans I
TITLE: Jesus among the Doctors
TECHNIQUE: Oil on wood, 250 x 220 cm (centre panel), 250 x 97 cm (wings)

DESCRIPTION: Among the first to respond were the Schoolmasters and the Soap-boilers, who shared an altar in the church.
AUTHOR: FRANCKEN, Frans I
TITLE: Jesus among the Doctors
TECHNIQUE: Oil on wood, 250 x 220 cm (centre panel), 250 x 97 cm (wings)

DESCRIPTION: They contracted Frans Francken to paint a triptych showing Jesus among the Doctors.
AUTHOR: FRANCKEN, Frans I
TITLE: Jesus among the Doctors
TECHNIQUE: Oil on wood, 250 x 220 cm (centre panel), 250 x 97 cm (wings)

DESCRIPTION: (The left wing depicts St Ambrose Baptising St Augustine, while the right wing the Miracle of the Flowing Oil.
AUTHOR: FRANCKEN, Frans I
TITLE: Jesus among the Doctors
TECHNIQUE: Oil on wood, 250 x 220 cm (centre panel), 250 x 97 cm (wings)

DESCRIPTION: )The scenes plainly have most to do with the schoolmasters.
AUTHOR: FRANCKEN, Frans I
TITLE: Jesus among the Doctors
TECHNIQUE: Oil on wood, 250 x 220 cm (centre panel), 250 x 97 cm (wings)

DESCRIPTION: The centre panel shows the episode from St Luke's Gospel in which the twelve-year-old Jesus debates theology with the Jewish scribes in the Temple at Jerusalem.
AUTHOR: FRANCKEN, Frans I
TITLE: Jesus among the Doctors
TECHNIQUE: Oil on wood, 250 x 220 cm (centre panel), 250 x 97 cm (wings)

DESCRIPTION: His parents, who have found him after a long search, look somewhat dejected.
AUTHOR: FRANCKEN, Frans I
TITLE: Jesus among the Doctors
TECHNIQUE: Oil on wood, 250 x 220 cm (centre panel), 250 x 97 cm (wings)

DESCRIPTION: The Temple is represented by a Renaissance church interior with a menorah and the Ark of the Covenant in the background.The left wing shows Ambrose, the patron saint of Antwerp's schoolmasters, baptising St Augustine in the presence of a canon-scholaster and several council members from the Schoolmasters' Guild.
AUTHOR: FRANCKEN, Frans I
TITLE: Jesus among the Doctors
TECHNIQUE: Oil on wood, 250 x 220 cm (centre panel), 250 x 97 cm (wings)

DESCRIPTION: The only reference to the Soap-boilers is in the right wing, where the Bible story of the Miracle of the Flowing Oil is depicted.
AUTHOR: FRANCKEN, Frans I
TITLE: Jesus among the Doctors
TECHNIQUE: Oil on wood, 250 x 220 cm (centre panel), 250 x 97 cm (wings)

DESCRIPTION: The prophet Elisha helped the widow of Zarephath out of debt by causing her oil jug to continuously replenish itself - an appropriate theme, for oil was one of the ingredients used by the soap-boilers.The style of the triptych is sober and didactic, as befits the schoolmasters, if not the soapmakers.
AUTHOR: FRANCKEN, Frans I
TITLE: Jesus among the Doctors
TECHNIQUE: Oil on wood, 250 x 220 cm (centre panel), 250 x 97 cm (wings)

DESCRIPTION: The balanced composition with its symmetrically arranged groups and the restrained presentation of the principal theme, without many secondary scenes or symbols, is characteristic of the Italian Renaissance, the latest artistic trend at the time
AUTHOR: FRANCKEN, Frans I
TITLE: Jesus among the Doctors
TECHNIQUE: Oil on wood, 250 x 220 cm (centre panel), 250 x 97 cm (wings)

DESCRIPTION: Charles V, seated on his throne, is stretching out his hands to his brother Ferdinand, on the left, and his son Philip, on the right.
AUTHOR: FRANCKEN, Frans II
TITLE: Allegory on the Abdication of Emperor Charles V in Brussels, 25 October 1555,

DESCRIPTION: With this gesture of abdication, Germany passed to Ferdinand and Spain and the Netherlands to Philip.
AUTHOR: FRANCKEN, Frans II
TITLE: Allegory on the Abdication of Emperor Charles V in Brussels, 25 October 1555,

DESCRIPTION: The women bearing standards symbolize the Emperor's Dutch, Spanish and Italian possessions.
AUTHOR: FRANCKEN, Frans II
TITLE: Allegory on the Abdication of Emperor Charles V in Brussels, 25 October 1555,

DESCRIPTION: Charles V is depicted as ruler of the world, with women representing Europe, America and India and Neptune the oceans.
AUTHOR: FRANCKEN, Frans II
TITLE: Allegory on the Abdication of Emperor Charles V in Brussels, 25 October 1555,

DESCRIPTION: Charles' motto was 'Plus Ultra' (= Further Yet)
AUTHOR: FRANCKEN, Frans II
TITLE: Allegory on the Abdication of Emperor Charles V in Brussels, 25 October 1555,

DESCRIPTION: In the same period when the most talented artists in the country had gathered around Rubens in Antwerp, there were also other artists working in Antwerp who still clung to the taste of Rubens' predecessors.
AUTHOR: FRANCKEN, Frans II
TITLE: Worship of the Golden Calf

DESCRIPTION: One of these was Frans II Francken, who painted Rockox's 'constcamer'.
AUTHOR: FRANCKEN, Frans II
TITLE: Worship of the Golden Calf

DESCRIPTION: He was a very popular artist in his time, and although he lacked any outstanding imaginative power or great technical skill, his fame rests on his ability to convert monumental subjects from large-scale art works to proportions more suitable for private houses.
AUTHOR: FRANCKEN, Frans II
TITLE: Worship of the Golden Calf

DESCRIPTION: The Worship of the Golden Calf is a typical example of the many religious and mythological scenes he painted
AUTHOR: FRANCKEN, Frans II
TITLE: Worship of the Golden Calf

DESCRIPTION: The Last Judgment by Hieronymus Francken II is the companion piece of the Damned Being Cast into Hell by Frans Francken II.
AUTHOR: FRANCKEN, Hieronymus, II
TITLE: The Last Judgment

DESCRIPTION: Frans II and Hieronymus II were brothers, they were taught by their uncle Hieronymus I at the same time.
AUTHOR: FRANCKEN, Hieronymus, II
TITLE: The Last Judgment

DESCRIPTION: This explains the similarity of their hand.
AUTHOR: FRANCKEN, Hieronymus, II
TITLE: The Last Judgment

DESCRIPTION: Both scenes were based on engravings from a cycle by Hendrik Goltzius.In the Last Judgment most of the figures were taken from Michelangelo's fresco in the Sistine Chapel in the Vatican
AUTHOR: FRANCKEN, Hieronymus, II
TITLE: The Last Judgment

DESCRIPTION: St Bruno was canonised in 1623, and so appeared frequently at that time in paintings from throughout southern Europe.Le Puy is the capital of the Haute Loire, part of a large upland area, the Massif central, in the southern central region of France.
AUTHOR: FRANÇOIS, Guy
TITLE: Holy Family with St Bruno and St Elisabeth

DESCRIPTION: The large number of Romanesque churches in and around the town bear testimony to the fact that it flourished in the Middle ages.
AUTHOR: FRANÇOIS, Guy
TITLE: Holy Family with St Bruno and St Elisabeth

DESCRIPTION: It was never an area noted for painting activity, and the return of Guy François from Rome to his native region was therefore to be of great significance in local terms, much more so than similar events in other centres where there was more than one painter active.
AUTHOR: FRANÇOIS, Guy
TITLE: Holy Family with St Bruno and St Elisabeth

DESCRIPTION: Guy François was to work in isolation for more than thirty years, gradually diluting his art as memories of what he had learned in Rome faded.
AUTHOR: FRANÇOIS, Guy
TITLE: Holy Family with St Bruno and St Elisabeth

DESCRIPTION: The pictures that he painted in France nearly all remain in and around Le Puy.It is only in recent years that the Italian period of Guy François has been reconstructed and his Italian pictures disentangled from the work of Carlo Saraceni.
AUTHOR: FRANÇOIS, Guy
TITLE: Holy Family with St Bruno and St Elisabeth

DESCRIPTION: Saraceni, a difficult artist to define, was essentially eclectic, with an unusual skill in brushwork almost akin to that of a northerner.
AUTHOR: FRANÇOIS, Guy
TITLE: Holy Family with St Bruno and St Elisabeth

DESCRIPTION: He assimilated many influences, ranging from Caravaggio to the German ERlsheimer.The picture by François that most shows the influence of Saraceni is the Holy Family with St Bruno and St Elisabeth, now in the Musée de l'Ain at Bourg-en-Bresse.
AUTHOR: FRANÇOIS, Guy
TITLE: Holy Family with St Bruno and St Elisabeth

DESCRIPTION: Like much of François's work, it was intended as a large altarpiece.
AUTHOR: FRANÇOIS, Guy
TITLE: Holy Family with St Bruno and St Elisabeth

DESCRIPTION: His altarpieces that survived in the Le Puy area, in the churches for which they were painted, are often surrounded by a provincial version of a sculptured and stuccoed framework in the Italian Baroque style.
AUTHOR: FRANÇOIS, Guy
TITLE: Holy Family with St Bruno and St Elisabeth

DESCRIPTION: Although commonplace in Italy, such pictures in situ are rare in France; most seventeenth century altarpieces by the major painters are now in museums.
AUTHOR: FRANÇOIS, Guy
TITLE: Holy Family with St Bruno and St Elisabeth

DESCRIPTION: The Holy Family altarpiece has the simplified forms sometimes found in works by Saraceni and also the strong lighting suitable for a prominent position in a church, where the picture would normally be seen from a distance.The strength of some of Guy François' compositions has led some authorities to suggest that he was influenced by Nicolas Tournier, but the most likely explanations for their superficial similarity are that both artists brought back from Italy similar Caravaggesque influences, and that both of them were forced to rely on what they had experienced and learned without renewed contact with their sources.
AUTHOR: FRANÇOIS, Guy
TITLE: Holy Family with St Bruno and St Elisabeth

DESCRIPTION: Both painter had a predilection for monumental scale, although François never achieved Tournier's dramatic intensity.
AUTHOR: FRANÇOIS, Guy
TITLE: Holy Family with St Bruno and St Elisabeth

DESCRIPTION: Instead he provided, in an area isolated from all artistic contact, a whole group of soundly painted and striking altarpieces
AUTHOR: FRANÇOIS, Guy
TITLE: Holy Family with St Bruno and St Elisabeth

DESCRIPTION: Although the present work is Venetian in character, the pose of the Madonna and Child, as well as the inclusion of the elaborate chair, is inspired by Raphael's celebrated painting of La Madonna della Sedia of 1513, today in the Galleria Palatina, Florence.The painting is signed lower left: NICOLAUS.
AUTHOR: FRANGIPANE, Niccol?
TITLE: The Holy Family with the Infant St John the Baptist

DESCRIPTION: FRANGI/ PANIS.
AUTHOR: FRANGIPANE, Niccol?
TITLE: The Holy Family with the Infant St John the Baptist

DESCRIPTION: F
