DESCRIPTION: The small pictures representing islands in the environs of Venice were formerly attributed to Francesco Guardi.
AUTHOR: GUARDI, Giacomo
TITLE: Landscape in the Environs of Venice

DESCRIPTION: Though the style and treatment of these pictures are fresh and airy, their quality falls far behind the standard of Francesco Guardi's works.
AUTHOR: GUARDI, Giacomo
TITLE: Landscape in the Environs of Venice

DESCRIPTION: The drawings and pictures of his son and imitator, Giacomo, are closest to the Budapest series which experts lately ranged unanimously among the oeuvre of the younger master
AUTHOR: GUARDI, Giacomo
TITLE: Landscape in the Environs of Venice

DESCRIPTION: Guercino is one of the most interesting personalities in seventeenth-century Bolognese art, and his activity in Rome made him an important influence on all Italian painting.
AUTHOR: GUERCINO
TITLE: Abraham Casting Out Hagar and Ishmael

DESCRIPTION: More than from Venice and Correggio, his work derives from Dosso Dossi and the school of Ferrara.
AUTHOR: GUERCINO
TITLE: Abraham Casting Out Hagar and Ishmael

DESCRIPTION: This painting represents one of the high points of Guercino's mature style.
AUTHOR: GUERCINO
TITLE: Abraham Casting Out Hagar and Ishmael

DESCRIPTION: Its restoration by the Brera's laboratory has revealed the original colours and eliminated the yellowish patina that obfuscated and partially hid the composition.The painting is built up on a measured circular rhythm, and the prominent gestures of the figures are emphasized almost to the point of theatricality.
AUTHOR: GUERCINO
TITLE: Abraham Casting Out Hagar and Ishmael

DESCRIPTION: Little Ishmael is crying and leaning his head against Hagar.
AUTHOR: GUERCINO
TITLE: Abraham Casting Out Hagar and Ishmael

DESCRIPTION: As she consoles him and holds out a handkerchief, she turns toward Abraham, who stands stern and still, making a gesture of repudiation.
AUTHOR: GUERCINO
TITLE: Abraham Casting Out Hagar and Ishmael

DESCRIPTION: Sarah, seen from behind, appears to be moving away from the scene.
AUTHOR: GUERCINO
TITLE: Abraham Casting Out Hagar and Ishmael

DESCRIPTION: The low-keyed colour helps avoid any rhetorical suggestion, while the slow rhythm of the composition creates a sense of inevitability.The city of Cento commissioned this painting, which was then presented to the Cardinal Legate of Ferrara, Lorenzo Imperiali
AUTHOR: GUERCINO
TITLE: Abraham Casting Out Hagar and Ishmael

DESCRIPTION: The ceiling painting in the Sala della Fama, the central hall on the second floor, is entirely allegorical.
AUTHOR: GUERCINO
TITLE: Ceiling painting

DESCRIPTION: The central picture is designed as a fictive opening with only a few figures.
AUTHOR: GUERCINO
TITLE: Ceiling painting

DESCRIPTION: In the centre hovers the personification of Fame in billowing robes, holding in her outstretched hands an extremely long trumpet and an olive branch as a symbol of peace.
AUTHOR: GUERCINO
TITLE: Ceiling painting

DESCRIPTION: Flying in front of her is the brightly feathered phoenix of myth, which is reborn out of its own ashes every five hundred years and was therefore considered a symbol of eternal renewal, but was understood also as a link to virtue.
AUTHOR: GUERCINO
TITLE: Ceiling painting

DESCRIPTION: In the lower part of the picture space personifications of Honour (Honos) and Virtue (Virtus) are seated on a dark gray cloud.
AUTHOR: GUERCINO
TITLE: Ceiling painting

DESCRIPTION: Amor Virtutis in the form of a putto turns toward them with laurel wreath and crown
AUTHOR: GUERCINO
TITLE: Ceiling painting

DESCRIPTION: Guérin's Napoleon Pardoning the Rebels at Cairo has a grain of truth, since Napoleon had shown clemency to the Mamluk leaders of the 1798 rising - but only after the slaughter of most of the insurgents.
AUTHOR: GUÉRIN, Pierre-Narcisse
TITLE: Napoleon Pardoning the Rebels at Cairo

DESCRIPTION: Guérin burnishes Napoleon's myth subtly, placing his hero to the rear and rather dwarfed by those he has pardoned, in a sort of inverted modesty.
AUTHOR: GUÉRIN, Pierre-Narcisse
TITLE: Napoleon Pardoning the Rebels at Cairo

DESCRIPTION: If the rebels are allowed dignity in defeat, it is to emphasize the magnanimity of the victor.
AUTHOR: GUÉRIN, Pierre-Narcisse
TITLE: Napoleon Pardoning the Rebels at Cairo

DESCRIPTION: The left wing represents the Angel Annunciate with Saints Francis, John the Baptist, Catherine of Alexandria and Mary Magdalene.The right wing represents the Virgin Annunciate with Saints Jerome, Augustine, Gregory and Anthony Abbot
AUTHOR: GUGLIELMO VENEZIANO
TITLE: Two Wings of a Triptych
TECHNIQUE: Tempera and gold on panel, 49 x 16 cm (each wing)

DESCRIPTION: This cupola decoration was painted by Bartolomeo Guidobono and Enrico Haffner in one of the free-standing chapels on the grounds of the Santuario della Misericordia near Savona.
AUTHOR: GUIDOBONO, Bartolomeo
TITLE: Cupola with panoramic view of the sanctuary

DESCRIPTION: The cupola fresco presents a bird's-eye view panorama of the pilgrimage site as though the ceiling were open and the painter standing at the level of the cornice were looking down at pilgrims streaming toward the church below
AUTHOR: GUIDOBONO, Bartolomeo
TITLE: Cupola with panoramic view of the sanctuary

DESCRIPTION: Hackaert specialised particularly in Italianate landscapes and woodland scenes, the present canvas depicting a wooded landscape with a shepherd and his herd is an example of the latter category.
AUTHOR: HACKAERT, Jan
TITLE: Wooded Landscape

DESCRIPTION: Influenced greatly by the respective styles of Dutch Italianate artists such as Jan Both and Jan Asselijn, Hackaert's treatment of colour owes much to these two predecessors.
AUTHOR: HACKAERT, Jan
TITLE: Wooded Landscape

DESCRIPTION: In this Neapolitan scene, the image is framed between two groups of trees at the far left and right, leaving a space in the centre in which the smoking Vesuvius is particularly prominent.
AUTHOR: HACKERT, Jacob Philipp
TITLE: Landscape with the Palace of Caserta and Vesuvius

DESCRIPTION: A broad panorama extends from the foreground to the volcano, while on the right is the Palace of Caserta, which stands out due to its large size
AUTHOR: HACKERT, Jacob Philipp
TITLE: Landscape with the Palace of Caserta and Vesuvius

DESCRIPTION: This signed and dated painting provides a view of the Lake Nemi from the north, with the town of Nemi and the town of Genzano beyond, with a donkey and travellers on a path in the foreground.Similar views of the Lake Nemi were painted by other 18th-century painters such as Claude-Joseph Vernet, John Robert Cozens, Joseph Wright, Solomon Delane, and  Nicolas-Didier Boguet
AUTHOR: HACKERT, Jacob Philipp
TITLE: View of Lake Nemi

DESCRIPTION: This self-portrait was executed between 1617 and 1619 when the influence of Dirck van Baburen is still evident in de Haen's work.
AUTHOR: HAEN, David de
TITLE: Self-Portrait

DESCRIPTION: It was long considered to be a self-portrait by Gerrit van Honthorst but was later given to de Haen
AUTHOR: HAEN, David de
TITLE: Self-Portrait

DESCRIPTION: At the time, it was a royal passion to put together collections of "naturalia et artificialia" and to display them on shelves in "Kunstkammer" ("art cabinets").
AUTHOR: HAINZ, Georg
TITLE: Cabinets of Curiosities

DESCRIPTION: The cabinets of curiosities (also known as Wunderkammer, Cabinets of Wonder, or wonder-rooms) were encyclopedic collections of types of objects belonging to natural history, geology, ethnography, archaeology, religious or historical relics, works of art (including cabinet paintings) and antiquities.
AUTHOR: HAINZ, Georg
TITLE: Cabinets of Curiosities

DESCRIPTION: Georg Hainz was a German painter specialized in still-lifes.
AUTHOR: HAINZ, Georg
TITLE: Cabinets of Curiosities

DESCRIPTION: He often used real objects for his paintings, which he then depicted with artistic freedom.
AUTHOR: HAINZ, Georg
TITLE: Cabinets of Curiosities

DESCRIPTION: The present painting represents a special type of vanitas still-life
AUTHOR: HAINZ, Georg
TITLE: Cabinets of Curiosities

DESCRIPTION: The portrait of the Officers of the St George Civic Guard is the first major group portrait by Frans Hals, and the first monumental civic guard painting in the new era of Dutch painting.
AUTHOR: HALS, Frans
TITLE: Banquet of the Officers of the St George Civic Guard

DESCRIPTION: Together with the leaders of public, charitable and professional associations, the civic guard societies were the main patrons to commission group portraits.
AUTHOR: HALS, Frans
TITLE: Banquet of the Officers of the St George Civic Guard

DESCRIPTION: This patronage took on considerable proportions in the course of the century.
AUTHOR: HALS, Frans
TITLE: Banquet of the Officers of the St George Civic Guard

DESCRIPTION: These group portraits are also of value as historical documents, for which lists were drawn up giving the names of the figures portrayed.
AUTHOR: HALS, Frans
TITLE: Banquet of the Officers of the St George Civic Guard

DESCRIPTION: The paintings themselves were displayed prominently on the premises of the respective association.These civic guard portraits were an expression of the Baroque will to representation, whose tradition is rooted in the medieval era.
AUTHOR: HALS, Frans
TITLE: Banquet of the Officers of the St George Civic Guard

DESCRIPTION: There had been civic guards in the Netherlands since the 13th century.
AUTHOR: HALS, Frans
TITLE: Banquet of the Officers of the St George Civic Guard

DESCRIPTION: They had played an important role in the emancipation of the cities and towns from feudal rule and had gained considerable political and military significance in the Netherlands' struggle for independence.Cornelis van Haarlem had already painted the officers of the St George Civic Guard in 1599.
AUTHOR: HALS, Frans
TITLE: Banquet of the Officers of the St George Civic Guard

DESCRIPTION: Hals, however, revolutionizes this type of painting.
AUTHOR: HALS, Frans
TITLE: Banquet of the Officers of the St George Civic Guard

DESCRIPTION: Instead of merely painting a row of individual portraits, he places them within a specific context by creating a banquet scene.
AUTHOR: HALS, Frans
TITLE: Banquet of the Officers of the St George Civic Guard

DESCRIPTION: This is not simply a moment captured at a table, but an extremely witty and calculated composition in which a scenic context is created between all the figures involved, and, on the other hand, each of the figures poses and acts independently and individually.

AUTHOR: HEYDEN, Jan van der
TITLE: View of the Westerkerk, Amsterdam

DESCRIPTION: Both serious and comic descriptions of Amsterdam called attention to the busy traffic of people and carts, to the crying children and fighting street dwellers, to dirt and to crime, but van der Heyden's city views edit out congestion, noise, transgression, and dust, and gloss over class distinctions.
AUTHOR: HEYDEN, Jan van der
TITLE: View of the Westerkerk, Amsterdam

DESCRIPTION: They thereby present a salutary image of a unified, prosperous city, a beautifully painted fiction affordable only to its prosperous elite.Van der Heyden's painting takes as its centerpiece the Westerkerk, a church designed in 1620 by Hendrick de Keyser, then the city's most famous architect.
AUTHOR: HEYDEN, Jan van der
TITLE: View of the Westerkerk, Amsterdam

DESCRIPTION: Although the structure owed much to earlier Netherlandish designs executed in warmly coloured local brick, its details are innovative.
AUTHOR: HEYDEN, Jan van der
TITLE: View of the Westerkerk, Amsterdam

TITLE: View of the Westerkerk, Amsterdam

DESCRIPTION: As the largest Protestant church built up to that time, it constituted a local answer to the magnificent tradition of Catholic building.Although de Keyser's church primarily served the Jordaan, a modest neighbourhood, van der Heyden represented it as seen from the stately Keizersgracht, the new Emperor's Canal
AUTHOR: HEYDEN, Jan van der
TITLE: View of the Westerkerk, Amsterdam

AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Elder
TITLE: Portrait of a Woman

DESCRIPTION: However, it is odd that they are depicted in different formats and poses, with the woman in profile and the man in less than full profile, his body slightly turned.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Elder
TITLE: Portrait of a Woman

DESCRIPTION: It would be more usual for them to be painted looking at each other in symmetrical poses
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Elder
TITLE: Portrait of a Woman

DESCRIPTION: The two panels in the Thyssen-Bornemisza collection, representing the portraits of a man and a woman, reveal the artist's interest in depicting the physical characteristics of his sitters, both of whom have rather pronounced features.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Elder
TITLE: Portrait of a Man

DESCRIPTION: Art historians have generally assumed the portraits to form a pair, possibly showing a husband and wife.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Elder
TITLE: Portrait of a Man

DESCRIPTION: However, it is odd that they are depicted in different formats and poses, with the woman in profile and the man in less than full profile, his body slightly turned.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Elder
TITLE: Portrait of a Man

DESCRIPTION: It would be more usual for them to be painted looking at each other in symmetrical poses
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Elder
TITLE: Portrait of a Man

DESCRIPTION: This painting is a copy of the portrait of Lady Mary Guildford (Art Museum, Saint Louis) executed in the mid-sixteenth century by an anonymous English artist
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Portrait of Lady Mary Guildford
TECHNIQUE: Oil and gold on oak panel, 82 x 66 cm

DESCRIPTION: Henry VIII (1491-1547), king of England (1509-47), who presided over the beginnings of the English Renaissance and the English Reformation.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Portrait of Henry VIII

DESCRIPTION: His six wives were, successively, Catherine of Aragon (the mother of the future queen Mary I), Anne Boleyn (the mother of the future queen Elizabeth I), Jane Seymour (the mother of Henry's successor, Edward VI), Anne of Cleves, Catherine Howard, and Catherine Parr.This portrait is the only surviving individual portrait of Henry that Holbein himself painted.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Portrait of Henry VIII

DESCRIPTION: In terms of features, it corresponds largely to the figure in the Whitehall cartoon.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Portrait of Henry VIII

DESCRIPTION: Both portraits are likely to have been based on a single, now lost portrait study by Holbein.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Portrait of Henry VIII

DESCRIPTION: However, as a consequence of the small format of the panel painting, the heavy shoulder chain that the king wears in the monumental portrait is omitted here, and his sleeves are embroidered with a very delicate gold thread.This is the quintessential image of the overbearing and tyrannous monarch, from the year the dissolution of the monasteries (and the consequent appropriation of their wealth for the Crown and its servants) was instigated.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Portrait of Henry VIII

DESCRIPTION: Holbein depicts the King at `face value', without flattery, emphasizing the small, humourless eyes and mouth, the curiously flat cheeks and chin.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Portrait of Henry VIII

DESCRIPTION: Henry's bulky and capricious authority haunts the work despite its small size.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Portrait of Henry VIII

DESCRIPTION: Its condensation of magnificence run riot here takes the form of real gold used in the chain, jewellery and collar.The portrait is undoubtedly a tour de force; after its execution, Holbein's position at the court seems to have been secure, and he was used as a painter-ambassador when the King's marital plans unraveled in the late 1530s.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Portrait of Henry VIII

DESCRIPTION: Only his misleading portrayal of Anne of Cleves would check his popularity.The subsequent spawning of similar but less effective portraits of the king by Holbein's followers has tended to obscure the compelling mixture of simplicity and realism displayed in this design - the tilt and curve of the black and white hat, the fearful symmetry of the jewelled jacket and the modelling of the hands: imitators often managed either simplicity or realism but never both.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Portrait of Henry VIII

DESCRIPTION: Jane Seymour (1509-1537) was the third wife of King Henry VIII of England and mother of King Edward VI.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Jane Seymour, Queen of England

DESCRIPTION: She succeeded - where Henry's previous wives had failed - in providing a legitimate male heir to the throne.Jane's father was Sir John Seymour of Wolf Hall, Savernake, Wiltshire.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Jane Seymour, Queen of England

DESCRIPTION: She became a lady in waiting to Henry's first wife, Catherine of Aragon, and then to Anne Boleyn, who married the King in 1533.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Jane Seymour, Queen of England

DESCRIPTION: Henry probably became attracted to Jane in 1535, when he visited her father at Wolf Hall, but, though willing to marry him, she refused to be his mistress.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Jane Seymour, Queen of England

DESCRIPTION: That determination undoubtedly helped bring about Anne Boleyn's downfall and execution (May 19, 1536).
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Jane Seymour, Queen of England

DESCRIPTION: On May 30, 1536, Henry and Jane were married privately.During the remaining 17 months of her life Jane managed to restore Mary, Henry's daughter by Catherine of Aragon, to the King's favour.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Jane Seymour, Queen of England

DESCRIPTION: Mary was a Roman Catholic, and some scholars have interpreted Jane's intercession to mean that she had little sympathy with the English Reformation.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Jane Seymour, Queen of England

DESCRIPTION: The future Edward VI was born on October 12, 1537, but, to Henry's genuine sorrow, Jane died 12 days later.Holbein executed this portrait shortly after the marriage of Henry VIII and Jane Seymour.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Jane Seymour, Queen of England

DESCRIPTION: In attitude and expression, the Seymour portrait matches that in the Whitehall composition, but the portraits differ in the arrangement of the bonnet veil; this individual portrait follows the preparatory study in the Royal Collection in Windsor Castle.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Jane Seymour, Queen of England

DESCRIPTION: This change is important only from a compositional point of view, and probably derived from Holbein himself.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Jane Seymour, Queen of England

DESCRIPTION: However, the major changes in tonality and patterns in Jane's gown will probably have been undertaken only after consultation with the client.Holbein's portrait depicts a figure frozen in an official sense of responsibility.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Jane Seymour, Queen of England

DESCRIPTION: The simplicity of the shadowed background accentuates the increasing richness and boldness of design and adornment in Henrician court fashion, and the artist's skill is pre-eminent in creating the sheen and lustre of the precious stones.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Jane Seymour, Queen of England

DESCRIPTION: Great attention has been paid to the realism of the silver thread in the queen's dress, and this new opulence was to be echoed in the portrait of Henry himself.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Jane Seymour, Queen of England

DESCRIPTION: This painting was one of a group of English portraits carried out by Holbein and his school.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Portrait of Henry VIII

DESCRIPTION: Though German, Holbein was court painter to King Henry VIII of England, and the prototype for this image is his lost mural that once decorated the Privy Chamber of Whitehall Palace in London.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Portrait of Henry VIII

DESCRIPTION: Carried out in 1537, that wall painting depicted the king with his third wife Jane Seymour, the only one of Henry's queens to bear him a male heir.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Portrait of Henry VIII

DESCRIPTION: Of the numerous paintings derived from that prototype, including a copy at Windsor Castle, this is without doubt the one of highest quality.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Portrait of Henry VIII

DESCRIPTION: The closest example to the prototype, on the other hand, is the portrait in the Thyssen collection in Madrid, which this version approaches especially in the rendering of the details of the collar (these passages were later modified, as is visible through reflectography).The Barberini portrait depicts the king in the same costume that he wore for his April, 1540, wedding to Anne of Cleves.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Portrait of Henry VIII

DESCRIPTION: The painting can thus be related to Duren's 1539 marriage portrait of Anne of Cleves (Louvre Museum, Paris), carried out in small dimensions and on canvas as it was meant to be transported.The attribution of the Rome version has been the subject of much discourse.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Portrait of Henry VIII

DESCRIPTION: It was considered to be an autograph work of Holbein, a copy of a lost original, the work of the master's workshop, the work of a close collaborator.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Portrait of Henry VIII

DESCRIPTION: An official engraving cut after this composition (Rijksmuseum, Amsterdam), adherent in its details to the Barberini picture, confirms the importance of this version of the image to the iconography of the king.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Portrait of Henry VIII

DESCRIPTION: Moreover, reflectographic examination of the painting has revealed characteristic underdrawing and other details that strongly suggest that the work is an autograph Holbein.The painting bears the inscription "ANNO ETATIS SUAE XLIX" (His year of age, 49).
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Portrait of Henry VIII

DESCRIPTION: John Chambers was 88 years old when Holbein executed this portrait.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Portrait of John Chambers

DESCRIPTION: The close similarity of the sitter with the man identified as Chambers in the barber surgeons' picture (on Henry's right) allow a definite identification.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Portrait of John Chambers

DESCRIPTION: Chambers was a cleric who also distinguished himself as a doctor.
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Portrait of John Chambers

DESCRIPTION: He was so successful in this profession that Henry VIII appointed him one of his personal physicians
AUTHOR: HOLBEIN, Hans the Younger
TITLE: Portrait of John Chambers

DESCRIPTION: Homer was a man with an immensely perceptive eye and a distinctive vision, and this picture is one of his masterpieces.
AUTHOR: HOMER, Winslow
TITLE: Northeaster

DESCRIPTION: The painting captures the essence of the wind whipped waves and rocky shore along the coast of Maine, where he spent the last 25 years of his life portraying the constant struggle between man and the turbulent ocean
AUTHOR: HOMER, Winslow
TITLE: Northeaster

DESCRIPTION: Gillis Claesz.
AUTHOR: HONDECOETER, Gillis Claesz. d'
TITLE: Baptism of the Moorish Chamberlain

DESCRIPTION: d'Hondecoeter was a member of a family of Dutch painters.
AUTHOR: HONDECOETER, Gillis Claesz. d'
TITLE: Baptism of the Moorish Chamberlain

DESCRIPTION: He was an artist often inspired by Roelandt Savery's landscapes crammed with domesticated and exotic birds and animals
AUTHOR: HONDECOETER, Gillis Claesz. d'
TITLE: Baptism of the Moorish Chamberlain

DESCRIPTION: This painting is closely related to another work by Honthors, a vertical version of the same theme in a private collection.
AUTHOR: HONTHORST, Gerrit van
TITLE: The Mocking of Christ
TECHNIQUE: Oil on canvas, 146 x 207 cm cm

DESCRIPTION: Since some of the same expressive devices are found in both pictures - for example , the way in which the extended hand of the standing mocker holding a candle casts its shadow on his face - both were likely to have been executed relatively close in time.The size of the canvas suggests that it was a public commisssion, perhaps for a church in or near Rome
AUTHOR: HONTHORST, Gerrit van
TITLE: The Mocking of Christ
TECHNIQUE: Oil on canvas, 146 x 207 cm cm

DESCRIPTION: Because painters, with some famous exceptions, were considered craftsmen on the level of carpenters or masons, it was not normal for a prince in Holland to deal with them directly.
AUTHOR: HONTHORST, Gerrit van
TITLE: Stadholder Frederik Hendrik, Prince of Orange

DESCRIPTION: However, Gerrit van Honthorst was able to work for all the courts and for several foreign ones as well.
AUTHOR: HONTHORST, Gerrit van
TITLE: Stadholder Frederik Hendrik, Prince of Orange

DESCRIPTION: One advantage he had is that he was hired to paint portraits of the royals, giving them quality time with princes and princesses and a chance to charm them.The pair of this painting, depicting Amalia van Solms, wife of Stadholder Frederik Hendrik (now in the Musée Jacquemart-André, Paris) was painted by Rembrandt
AUTHOR: HONTHORST, Gerrit van
TITLE: Stadholder Frederik Hendrik, Prince of Orange

DESCRIPTION: The painting represents Frederick Henry (Frederik Hendrik in Dutch) (1584-1647), Prince of Orange and Stadholder of Holland from 1625 to 1647.
AUTHOR: HONTHORST, Gerrit van
TITLE: Frederick Hendrick, Prince of Orange, with His Wife Amalia van Solms and Their Three Youngest Daughters
TECHNIQUE: Oil on canvas, 264 cm x 348 cm

DESCRIPTION: He was the youngest child of William the Silent, and was born at Delft about six months before his father's assassination.
AUTHOR: HONTHORST, Gerrit van
TITLE: Frederick Hendrick, Prince of Orange, with His Wife Amalia van Solms and Their Three Youngest Daughters
TECHNIQUE: Oil on canvas, 264 cm x 348 cm

DESCRIPTION: Frederick Henry was married in 1625 to Amalia van Solms-Braunfels, and left one son, William II of Orange, and four daughters.
AUTHOR: HONTHORST, Gerrit van
TITLE: Frederick Hendrick, Prince of Orange, with His Wife Amalia van Solms and Their Three Youngest Daughters
TECHNIQUE: Oil on canvas, 264 cm x 348 cm

DESCRIPTION: In the centre of the painting is Amalia, at her side their youngest daughter Maria.
AUTHOR: HONTHORST, Gerrit van
TITLE: Frederick Hendrick, Prince of Orange, with His Wife Amalia van Solms and Their Three Youngest Daughters
TECHNIQUE: Oil on canvas, 264 cm x 348 cm

DESCRIPTION: On the right are their daughters Albertina Agnes and Henrietta
AUTHOR: HONTHORST, Gerrit van
TITLE: Frederick Hendrick, Prince of Orange, with His Wife Amalia van Solms and Their Three Youngest Daughters
TECHNIQUE: Oil on canvas, 264 cm x 348 cm

DESCRIPTION: This painting, also titled as A Merry Company with Two Men and Two Women, is one of the first genre pictures by De Hooch in which the figures rise above the level of soldiers visiting inns and in which the setting makes tentative claims to gentility.
AUTHOR: HOOCH, Pieter de
TITLE: The Visit

DESCRIPTION: De Hooch took the ideas from Anthonie Palamedesz and Jacob van Velsen in Delft and from many painters in other cities.
AUTHOR: HOOCH, Pieter de
TITLE: The Visit

DESCRIPTION: The Visit  represents the domestication of a social theme that had earlier been set mostly in taverns and bordellos.
AUTHOR: HOOCH, Pieter de
TITLE: The Visit

DESCRIPTION: In slightly later years De Hooch would depict more luxurious rooms and superficially more polite behaviour than he did in this key work of his early maturity
AUTHOR: HOOCH, Pieter de
TITLE: The Visit

DESCRIPTION: This minor work by Pieter de Hooch represents a transitional phase between his tavern scenes of the early 1650s and his domestic interiors and courtyard views of about 1658 onward
AUTHOR: HOOCH, Pieter de
TITLE: A Woman and Two Men in an Arbour

DESCRIPTION: Pieter de Hooch's painting belongs to the 'haute-bourgeois' genre.
AUTHOR: HOOCH, Pieter de
TITLE: Couple with Parrot

DESCRIPTION: Through an anteroom we see a tidy living room with an elegantly clothed couple.
AUTHOR: HOOCH, Pieter de
TITLE: Couple with Parrot

DESCRIPTION: The man is opening the cage with the parrot and the woman is enticing the bird out with a wine glass.
AUTHOR: HOOCH, Pieter de
TITLE: Couple with Parrot

DESCRIPTION: These are clearly erotic symbols which indicate that the young woman is about to be seduced into an affair
AUTHOR: HOOCH, Pieter de
TITLE: Couple with Parrot

DESCRIPTION: This painting is one of De Hooch's variations on an amorous theme.
AUTHOR: HOOCH, Pieter de
TITLE: Woman with a Water Pitcher, and a Man by a Bed

DESCRIPTION: The motif of pulling on a stocking and that of a dog nosing about were both recognized in De Hooch's day as sexual innuendos when the context supported such readings.The painting is a fragment of a broader canvas, it has lost about 17 cm on the right
AUTHOR: HOOCH, Pieter de
TITLE: Woman with a Water Pitcher, and a Man by a Bed

DESCRIPTION: Van Hoogstraten's most concentrated period of genre painting production occurred only during the last years of his career, around 1670—71.
AUTHOR: HOOGSTRATEN, Samuel van
TITLE: The Anaemic Lady

DESCRIPTION: These later pictures exhibit limited subject matter focusing primarily upon domestic themes.
AUTHOR: HOOGSTRATEN, Samuel van
TITLE: The Anaemic Lady

DESCRIPTION: Especially fascinating is his Anaemic Lady (and its pendant of Two Women by a Cradle, dated 1670, Museum of Fine Arts, Springfield).
AUTHOR: HOOGSTRATEN, Samuel van
TITLE: The Anaemic Lady

DESCRIPTION: In the Anaemic Lady a taciturn physician examines a flask containing the urine of an ailing young woman while another man (her husband?)
AUTHOR: HOOGSTRATEN, Samuel van
TITLE: The Anaemic Lady

DESCRIPTION: looks on.
AUTHOR: HOOGSTRATEN, Samuel van
TITLE: The Anaemic Lady

DESCRIPTION: This event takes place in a well-appointed house; the recession of space through two rooms in the background allows the viewer to scrutinize some very interesting paintings hanging on the walls and a sliver of a brilliantly illuminated gilt-leather wall-hanging.
AUTHOR: HOOGSTRATEN, Samuel van
TITLE: The Anaemic Lady

DESCRIPTION: The inclusion of gilt-leather wall-hangings (an expensive decorative accouterment at this time), costly paintings, and sumptuous fabrics enhances the aura of opulence exuded by the painting
AUTHOR: HOOGSTRATEN, Samuel van
TITLE: The Anaemic Lady

DESCRIPTION: The painting is identified as a double portrait of Johan Cornelis Vijgeboom  (died 1665), a wealthy Dordrecht grocer and his wife Anneken Joosten Boogaert.
AUTHOR: HOOGSTRATEN, Samuel van
TITLE: Portrait of Johan Cornelisz. Vijgeboom and His Wife

DESCRIPTION: It depicts Vijgeboom handing his wife, Anneken Joosten Boogaert a tulip in the garden of their manor house near Dubbeldam (the vicinity of Dordrecht).The painting is signed and dated left centre: S. v. Hooghstraten 1647
AUTHOR: HOOGSTRATEN, Samuel van
TITLE: Portrait of Johan Cornelisz. Vijgeboom and His Wife

DESCRIPTION: The Flemish painters Jan Jozef Horemans I (1682-1759) and his son Jan Jozef Horemans II continued in the 18th century the Flemish tradition of interiors
AUTHOR: HOREMANS, Jan Jozef II
TITLE: The Marriage Contract

DESCRIPTION: Artemisia was the wife of Mausolus, the satrap of Caria in Asia Minor.
AUTHOR: HOUBRAKEN, Arnold
TITLE: Commemoration of King Mausolus by Queen Artemisia

DESCRIPTION: She succeeded her husband on his death in 353 B.C., and erected a great monument to his memory at Halicarnassus - hence 'mausoleum'.
AUTHOR: HOUBRAKEN, Arnold
TITLE: Commemoration of King Mausolus by Queen Artemisia

DESCRIPTION: It was one of the seven wonders of the ancient world.
AUTHOR: HOUBRAKEN, Arnold
TITLE: Commemoration of King Mausolus by Queen Artemisia

DESCRIPTION: It was said that she mixed the ashes of Mausolus in liquid which she then drank, thereby making herself, observes Valerius Maximus, making of herself a living, breathing tomb.
AUTHOR: HOUBRAKEN, Arnold
TITLE: Commemoration of King Mausolus by Queen Artemisia

DESCRIPTION: Artemisia symbolizes a widow's devotion to her husband's memory.
AUTHOR: HOUBRAKEN, Arnold
TITLE: Commemoration of King Mausolus by Queen Artemisia

DESCRIPTION: In Renaissance painting she is depicted holding a cup or goblet.This painting appears to be influenced by the paintings of the Leidein fijnschilders
AUTHOR: HOUBRAKEN, Arnold
TITLE: Commemoration of King Mausolus by Queen Artemisia

DESCRIPTION: In this scene set around the pulpit in the Oude Kerks's nave, Houckgeest departs from his main interest in the works of 1650-51 which are concerned with the Delft churches themselves and their most important tomb monuments.
AUTHOR: HOUCKGEEST, Gerard
TITLE: Interior of the Oude Kerk, Delft, with the Pulpit of 1548

DESCRIPTION: Here the principal points of interest include the casual encounter of a man and woman in the foreground, the illusionistic curtain and wood frame; the picturesque sunlight streaming through crystalline air; the coral colour of the column bases, of the brick arches in the transept, and of figures in the stained-glass.The painting is signed in monogram and dated centre bottom on the fictive frame, in foreshortening: GH 165(1)
AUTHOR: HOUCKGEEST, Gerard
TITLE: Interior of the Oude Kerk, Delft, with the Pulpit of 1548

DESCRIPTION: This large canvas represents a vision of a palace architecture.
AUTHOR: HOUCKGEEST, Gerard
TITLE: View through an Arcade

DESCRIPTION: It could be mistaken for an idealized souvenir of Rome if all the figures were not in Dutch costume.
AUTHOR: HOUCKGEEST, Gerard
TITLE: View through an Arcade

DESCRIPTION: Most of them appear to come from the upper levels of society.
AUTHOR: HOUCKGEEST, Gerard
TITLE: View through an Arcade

DESCRIPTION: The painting may be placed within a tradition of imaginary architectural painting that flourished in London and The Hague between about 1610 and 1650.The painting is signed and dated lower right, on the column base: G. Houckgeest fe: 1638
AUTHOR: HOUCKGEEST, Gerard
TITLE: View through an Arcade

DESCRIPTION: Huber was a German painter, draughtsman and woodcut artist, who, after Altdorfer, was the most important member of the Danube school.
AUTHOR: HUBER, Wolf
TITLE: Portrait of Jacob Ziegler

DESCRIPTION: He worked in Regensburg and Passau.
AUTHOR: HUBER, Wolf
TITLE: Portrait of Jacob Ziegler

DESCRIPTION: Few paintings by him are known and it is in woodcuts and drawings that his lyrical approach to landscape can best be seen.The sitter of this portrait, Jacob Ziegler, was a scholar who lived a wandering life in Europe.
AUTHOR: HUBER, Wolf
TITLE: Portrait of Jacob Ziegler

DESCRIPTION: In his old age he lived in the house of the Bishop of Passau.
AUTHOR: HUBER, Wolf
TITLE: Portrait of Jacob Ziegler

DESCRIPTION: This portrait was executed here when he was about seventy years old
AUTHOR: HUBER, Wolf
TITLE: Portrait of Jacob Ziegler

DESCRIPTION: This painting is pointillist in its handling of the grassy slope but Neo-Romantic in its atmospherics, which inform the composition and colours and insist on a rhythm of curves (as in the tree reflections in the lake, or the slender tree trunks at left) such as was characteristic of heavily stylised European art at the turn of the century
AUTHOR: HUDE?EK, Antonín
TITLE: Quiet Evening

DESCRIPTION: The painting represents Sir James Lowther, 1st Earl of Lonsdale (1736-1802) three-quarter length, holding a mask in his right hand.
AUTHOR: HUDSON, Thomas
TITLE: Portrait of Sir James Lowther

DESCRIPTION: James Lowther was one of the richest commoners in Britain.
AUTHOR: HUDSON, Thomas
TITLE: Portrait of Sir James Lowther

DESCRIPTION: He wielded enormous political power, returning nine members to the House of Commons, including William Pitt
AUTHOR: HUDSON, Thomas
TITLE: Portrait of Sir James Lowther

DESCRIPTION: This canvas presents a still-life with a 'brioche' bread, oysters, a flute-glass, grapes and pears, a drapery and game, all on a stone plinth.
AUTHOR: HUILLIOT, Pierre Nicolas
TITLE: Still-Life

DESCRIPTION: It is dominated by the large 'brioche' bread, placed in the upper left, with a flute-glass containing red wine behind it.It is signed with monogram 'NH', lower right on the drapery.
AUTHOR: HUILLIOT, Pierre Nicolas
TITLE: Still-Life

DESCRIPTION: In keeping with realism, the artist's signature is 'embroidered' on the rim of the drapery
AUTHOR: HUILLIOT, Pierre Nicolas
TITLE: Still-Life

DESCRIPTION: This painting depicts a landscape with travellers in a horse drawn carriage and figures conversing by a track.
AUTHOR: IBBETSON, Julius Caesar
TITLE: Landscape with Travellers

DESCRIPTION: In the rural scene, the artist creates a fine contrast between the frenetic coachman, spurring his horses into a furious gallop and the leisurely exchange amongst the group of figures in the foreground of the work
AUTHOR: IBBETSON, Julius Caesar
TITLE: Landscape with Travellers

DESCRIPTION: This painting was discovered in 1989 and attributed to Isenbrant.
AUTHOR: ISENBRANT, Adriaen
TITLE: Virgin and Child Enthroned
TECHNIQUE: Oil on oak panel, 77,5 x 56,5 cm

DESCRIPTION: It was carefully copied, albeit in a different style, from Memling's Berlin Virgin Enthroned.
AUTHOR: ISENBRANT, Adriaen
TITLE: Virgin and Child Enthroned
TECHNIQUE: Oil on oak panel, 77,5 x 56,5 cm

DESCRIPTION: The figure has been copied from Memling's work by means of a punch-cardboard and the colours also correspond, which shows that the work was then still accessible in Bruges.
AUTHOR: ISENBRANT, Adriaen
TITLE: Virgin and Child Enthroned
TECHNIQUE: Oil on oak panel, 77,5 x 56,5 cm

DESCRIPTION: Isenbrant carried out some adaptations in Renaissance style, turning the original open portico into a semi-circular niche with medallions, baluster columns and a solid stone throne.
AUTHOR: ISENBRANT, Adriaen
TITLE: Virgin and Child Enthroned
TECHNIQUE: Oil on oak panel, 77,5 x 56,5 cm

DESCRIPTION: Moreover, the book of hours has been given sixteenth-century floral borders in the Ghent-Bruges style and the flat top of the panel changed into an ogive shape.It is a remarkable example of the way in which Memling's compositions served as models until the sixteenth century
AUTHOR: ISENBRANT, Adriaen
TITLE: Virgin and Child Enthroned
TECHNIQUE: Oil on oak panel, 77,5 x 56,5 cm

DESCRIPTION: Franz von Soist was a doctor in Ehrenbreitstein, on the opposite side of the Rhine from Coblenz.
AUTHOR: ITTENBACH, Franz
TITLE: Portrait of Dr. Franz Xavier von Soist

DESCRIPTION: He and his wife were most likely members of the local Catholic haute-bourgeoisie, from whom many of Ittenbach's portraits were commissioned.It can be seen in Dr.
AUTHOR: ITTENBACH, Franz
TITLE: Portrait of Dr. Franz Xavier von Soist

DESCRIPTION: von Soist's likeness, Ittenbach was capable of a sophisticated sense of immediacy in his portraiture which almost suggests a sort of German Ingres
AUTHOR: ITTENBACH, Franz
TITLE: Portrait of Dr. Franz Xavier von Soist

DESCRIPTION: The painting, the central panel of a retable of the Last Supper, was left unfinished by the artist when he was summoned to Italy by the King Alfonso V of Aragon.
AUTHOR: JACOMART, Jaume Baço
TITLE: The Last Supper

DESCRIPTION: It was completed by a collaborator, perhaps Juan Reixach
AUTHOR: JACOMART, Jaume Baço
TITLE: The Last Supper

DESCRIPTION: The painter represented this subject in two paintings (in the Los Angeles County Museum of Art and in the Hermitage).
AUTHOR: JACOPO DA EMPOLI
TITLE: Supper at Emmaus

DESCRIPTION: These are half-figure compositions on a neutral dark background in which the figure of Christ is almost identical
AUTHOR: JACOPO DA EMPOLI
TITLE: Supper at Emmaus

DESCRIPTION: A particularly accomplished draughtsman, Empoli (actually Jacopo Chimenti) presents us here with an austere composition, one which succeeds in avoiding the least hint of sentimentalism, yet is nonetheless psychologically charged.
AUTHOR: JACOPO DA EMPOLI
TITLE: Sacrifice of Isaac

DESCRIPTION: The figures are well-constructed, well-finished and dignified, and the faces are expressive, each stricken by the enormity of the dramatic event.
AUTHOR: JACOPO DA EMPOLI
TITLE: Sacrifice of Isaac

DESCRIPTION: The landscape is simple and naturalistic, and not at all schematised
AUTHOR: JACOPO DA EMPOLI
TITLE: Sacrifice of Isaac

DESCRIPTION: The panel representing The Resurrection is one of the six upper tier panels of the altarpiece.
AUTHOR: JACOPO DI CIONE
TITLE: San Pier Maggiore Altarpiece: The Resurrection
TECHNIQUE: Egg tempera on wood, 96 x 49 cm

DESCRIPTION: The iconography of the scene can be related to the frescoes in the Spanish Chapel in Santa Maria Novella, Florence by Andrea da Firenze
AUTHOR: JACOPO DI CIONE
TITLE: San Pier Maggiore Altarpiece: The Resurrection

DESCRIPTION: Whatever the subject, he invariably combined carefully observed, often richly coloured naturalistic details, with a sense of controlled abstract design.This painting was made in about 1830, when he was developing his mature style, and shows the bakery in the Kastel, which is a castle in Copenhagen that served as a prison.

DESCRIPTION: Knowing her son was destined to die if he went to fight in the Trojan war, Thethis, a sea nymph, disguised Achilles as a woman and entrusted him to King Lycomedes, in whose palace on the isle of Scyros he lived among the king's daughters.
AUTHOR: LAIRESSE, Gérard de
TITLE: Achilles Discovered among the Daughters of Lycomedes

DESCRIPTION: Odysseus and other Greek chieftains were sent to fetch Achilles.
AUTHOR: LAIRESSE, Gérard de
TITLE: Achilles Discovered among the Daughters of Lycomedes

DESCRIPTION: They cunningly laid a heap of gifts before the girls - jewellery, clothes and other finery, but among them a sword, spear and shield.
AUTHOR: LAIRESSE, Gérard de
TITLE: Achilles Discovered among the Daughters of Lycomedes

DESCRIPTION: When a trumpet was sounded, Achilles instinctively snatched up the weapons and thus betrayed his identity.Lairesse, like all other artists who rendered the subject, chose the scene Achilles examining the weapons
AUTHOR: LAIRESSE, Gérard de
TITLE: Achilles Discovered among the Daughters of Lycomedes

DESCRIPTION: The picture shows a wooded landscape with figures resting by a stream
AUTHOR: LAMBERT, George
TITLE: Wooded Landscape

DESCRIPTION: This painting is the largest of four variants of this subject painted by the artist; smaller versions are in the Wallace Collection, London, The Hermitage, St.
AUTHOR: LANCRET, Nicolas
TITLE: La Camargo Dancing

DESCRIPTION: Petersburg, and the Musée des Beaux-Arts, Nantes.
AUTHOR: LANCRET, Nicolas
TITLE: La Camargo Dancing

DESCRIPTION: The Washington version is the only one in which Camargo  is accompanied by a male dancer and several spectators
AUTHOR: LANCRET, Nicolas
TITLE: La Camargo Dancing

DESCRIPTION: Lancret was a painter of rustic entertainments and the theatre.
AUTHOR: LANCRET, Nicolas
TITLE: Company in the Park

DESCRIPTION: Although he borrowed Watteau's thematic repertory and style, he does not attain the universal, poetic dimension of his work
AUTHOR: LANCRET, Nicolas
TITLE: Company in the Park

DESCRIPTION: The composition reflects Lancret's dependence on Watteau, under whom he had briefly studied c.
AUTHOR: LANCRET, Nicolas
TITLE: Fete in a Wood

DESCRIPTION: Watteau's profound poetic feeling becomes in Lancret no more than a picturesque and amiable evocation of the life of society
AUTHOR: LANCRET, Nicolas
TITLE: Fete in a Wood

DESCRIPTION: The decorative pendants, Le Moulinet, and Dance in a Pavilion, are typical of Lancret's art, with women who are almost alarmingly unindividualized and men but a bit more identifiable
AUTHOR: LANCRET, Nicolas
TITLE: Le Moulinet

DESCRIPTION: This painting is a study for a larger one which belonged to a cycle of eight canvases depicting exotic hunt scenes.
AUTHOR: LANCRET, Nicolas
TITLE: Tiger Hunt

DESCRIPTION: The cycle was commissioned for one of the small royal apartment if the castle of Versailles from Jean-François de Troy, François Boucher, Charles Parrocel, Nicolas Lancret, Jean Baptiste Vanloo and Jean Baptiste Pater.
AUTHOR: LANCRET, Nicolas
TITLE: Tiger Hunt

DESCRIPTION: The cycle is now conserved at the Mudée de Picardie, Amiens
AUTHOR: LANCRET, Nicolas
TITLE: Tiger Hunt

DESCRIPTION: This is an early painting by Landseer, dating from the formative years of his career when he conquered London society as a youthful prodigy.
AUTHOR: LANDSEER, Sir Edwin Henry
TITLE: A Greyhound with a Hare

DESCRIPTION: This work is fascinating in that it illustrates the romantic origins of Landseer's art; both the violent subject and the course brushwork suggest that the work of James Ward was the major influence on the young artist
AUTHOR: LANDSEER, Sir Edwin Henry
TITLE: A Greyhound with a Hare

DESCRIPTION: Three fancy-dress balls were held at Buckingham Palace by Queen Victoria and Prince Albert, each in a different style.
AUTHOR: LANDSEER, Sir Edwin Henry
TITLE: Queen Victoria and Prince Albert at the Bal Costumé of 12 May 1842

DESCRIPTION: At the first on 12 May 1842 the principal figures appeared as Edward III (1312-77) and Queen Philippa (1314?-69).
AUTHOR: LANDSEER, Sir Edwin Henry
TITLE: Queen Victoria and Prince Albert at the Bal Costumé of 12 May 1842

DESCRIPTION: The second, on 6 June 1845, was in early Georgian dress and the third, on 13 June 1851, in the style of the Restoration.Landseer has painted Queen Victoria and Prince Albert in the Throne Room on the occasion of the fancy-dress ball of 1842, standing beneath a specially designed Gothic canopy decorated with purple velvet hangings.
AUTHOR: LANDSEER, Sir Edwin Henry
TITLE: Queen Victoria and Prince Albert at the Bal Costumé of 12 May 1842

DESCRIPTION: Two chairs of state are visible behind the figures and above their heads on the cloth of honour is emblazoned the coat-of-arms of Edward III, combining French and English quarterings.
AUTHOR: LANDSEER, Sir Edwin Henry
TITLE: Queen Victoria and Prince Albert at the Bal Costumé of 12 May 1842

DESCRIPTION: It was from this alcove that Queen Victoria and Prince Albert greeted over 2,000 guests.
AUTHOR: LANDSEER, Sir Edwin Henry
TITLE: Queen Victoria and Prince Albert at the Bal Costumé of 12 May 1842

DESCRIPTION: Members of the Royal Household were expected to appear in costumes dating in style from the reign of Edward III, while the guests were encouraged to wear costumes of any period or country.
AUTHOR: LANDSEER, Sir Edwin Henry
TITLE: Queen Victoria and Prince Albert at the Bal Costumé of 12 May 1842

DESCRIPTION: The setting for the ball and the design of the costumes were entrusted to James Robinson Planche, who was an authority on the history of dress, as evidenced by his encyclopaedic book History of British Costume (1834), as well as a dramatist and a herald in the College of Arms.The costumes worn by Queen Victoria and Prince Albert were designed by Vouillon and Laure with the guidance of Planche.
AUTHOR: LANDSEER, Sir Edwin Henry
TITLE: Queen Victoria and Prince Albert at the Bal Costumé of 12 May 1842

DESCRIPTION: For the sake of accuracy reference was made to the relevant monuments in Westminster Abbey.
AUTHOR: LANDSEER, Sir Edwin Henry
TITLE: Queen Victoria and Prince Albert at the Bal Costumé of 12 May 1842

DESCRIPTION: The queen's costume was based upon the effigies of Philippa of Hainault and her daughter Blanche de la Tour (died in infancy 1342), while that for Prince Albert was derived from the effigy of Edward III.
AUTHOR: LANDSEER, Sir Edwin Henry
TITLE: Queen Victoria and Prince Albert at the Bal Costumé of 12 May 1842

DESCRIPTION: Landseer began his painting at the time of the ball, but, as was so often the case with this artist, progress was delayed and the picture was not finished until 1846.
AUTHOR: LANDSEER, Sir Edwin Henry
TITLE: Queen Victoria and Prince Albert at the Bal Costumé of 12 May 1842

DESCRIPTION: The artist probaly painted this painting in Naples.
AUTHOR: LANFRANCO, Giovanni
TITLE: The Annunciation

DESCRIPTION: A study drawing to this picture is in the Royal Collection, Windsor Castle
AUTHOR: LANFRANCO, Giovanni
TITLE: The Annunciation

DESCRIPTION: Shortly after the completion of the ceiling in the Galleria of the Palazzo Farnese, Annibale and his pupils, who included Domenichino and Giovanni Lanfranco, were asked to provide decorations for a palazzetto behind Palazzo Farnese, across the Via Giulia.
AUTHOR: LANFRANCO, Giovanni
TITLE: Mary Magdalen Raised by Angels

DESCRIPTION: The decoration consisted of mainly landscapes.
AUTHOR: LANFRANCO, Giovanni
TITLE: Mary Magdalen Raised by Angels

DESCRIPTION: In keeping with the character of the building, a casino in a garden, they represented mythological episodes.
AUTHOR: LANFRANCO, Giovanni
TITLE: Mary Magdalen Raised by Angels

DESCRIPTION: A few years later, Cardinal Odoardo Farnese decided to add a small room (Camerino degli Eremiti) to the Palazzetto Farnese as a Christian retreat where he could withdraw for his devotion.
AUTHOR: LANFRANCO, Giovanni
TITLE: Mary Magdalen Raised by Angels

DESCRIPTION: Giovanni Lanfranco was responsible for its entire decoration which consisted of four large frescoes, and nine ceiling panels, only two of which survived, Mary Magdalen Raised by Angels and Christ Served by Angels
AUTHOR: LANFRANCO, Giovanni
TITLE: Mary Magdalen Raised by Angels

DESCRIPTION: Painted by Lanfranco at the commission of Giacomo Simonelli, this painting decorated Simonelli's family chapel which was dedicated to Saint Ursula.
AUTHOR: LANFRANCO, Giovanni
TITLE: St Ursula and the Virgins

DESCRIPTION: In 1630 the church, Santa Marta in Vaticano, was destroyed to clear space for the construction of the Vatican's Palazzo del Governatorato.
AUTHOR: LANFRANCO, Giovanni
TITLE: St Ursula and the Virgins

DESCRIPTION: A date of 1622 was proposed for the picture on the basis of stylistic analogies with Lanfranco's Saint Margherita of Cortona, signed and dated by the artist in 1622 (Galleria Palatina, Palazzo Pitti, Florence).
AUTHOR: LANFRANCO, Giovanni
TITLE: St Ursula and the Virgins

DESCRIPTION: The Saint Ursula does not belong to the most refined and elegant phase of Lanfranco's career (1618-20), but rather to a slightly later phase of around 1622-24.
AUTHOR: LANFRANCO, Giovanni
TITLE: St Ursula and the Virgins

DESCRIPTION: This protobaroque period for Lanfranco is characterized by a more robust and vigorous style that is a prelude to the artist's full baroque work of 1624-25.In the same years Lanfranco also carried out another work for the Simonelli family at Santa Marta, an altarpiece similar in typology and style to the Saint Ursula.
AUTHOR: LANFRANCO, Giovanni
TITLE: St Ursula and the Virgins

DESCRIPTION: Showing the Virgin and Child and Saints James and Anthony Abbot, the painting is now in the Kunsthistorisches Museum in Vienna
AUTHOR: LANFRANCO, Giovanni
TITLE: St Ursula and the Virgins

DESCRIPTION: Alternative attribution to Cesare di Sesto, another artist in the circle of Leonardo da Vinci, is also proposed.
AUTHOR: LANINO, Bernardino
TITLE: St John the Baptist in the Wilderness

DESCRIPTION: The original concept of the painting derives from Leonardo's St John in the Louvre
AUTHOR: LANINO, Bernardino
TITLE: St John the Baptist in the Wilderness

DESCRIPTION: This painting shows the Madonna and Child in a landscape with the Infant Saint John the Baptist.
AUTHOR: LARCIANI, Giovanni di Lorenzo
TITLE: Virgin and Child

DESCRIPTION: It betrays the influence of Francesco Granacci.
AUTHOR: LARCIANI, Giovanni di Lorenzo
TITLE: Virgin and Child

DESCRIPTION: The figure of St John recurs in a number of Granacci's paintings of the same subject
AUTHOR: LARCIANI, Giovanni di Lorenzo

DESCRIPTION: Largillière also painted pure landscapes - or landscapes peopled only by such minute, unimportant figures as can be deciphered, just, in this autumnal woodland Landscape, which looks backward to Rubens and forward to Fragonard.
AUTHOR: LARGILLI?RE, Nicolas de
TITLE: Landscape

DESCRIPTION: There is real poetry in its vigour, and a delight in the wildness of nature, in towering trees and rich foliage, which makes one regret that this aspect of his art is so rare.
AUTHOR: LARGILLI?RE, Nicolas de
TITLE: Landscape

DESCRIPTION: Combined with his still-lifes and with the fascinating trompe l'oeil decorations of his own house, it helps to explain contemporary appreciation of him as a 'universal' painter
AUTHOR: LARGILLI?RE, Nicolas de
TITLE: Landscape

DESCRIPTION: Together with Hyacinthe Rigaud, Largilliere was the most sought-after French portrait painter of the early 18th century, giving the aristocratic formal portrait developed by Rigaud a sober, more realistic aspect, complementing the magnificent poses and incidental detail with a lifelike rendering of the face.In this portrait of an unidentified sitter in a somewhat extended head-and-shoulders view, the subject looks out, calm and self-assured, his noble features framed by the luxuriant full-bottomed wig and loosely-draped purple robe
AUTHOR: LARGILLI?RE, Nicolas de
TITLE: Portrait of a Man in a Purple Robe

DESCRIPTION: Jean-Baptiste Rousseau (1671-1741) was a French dramatist and poet who enjoyed great popularity in the witty and decadent Parisian society of his day.
AUTHOR: LARGILLI?RE, Nicolas de
TITLE: Portrait of Jean-Baptiste Rousseau

DESCRIPTION: The nonchalant realism of this portrait is a style that Largillière helped develop
AUTHOR: LARGILLI?RE, Nicolas de
TITLE: Portrait of Jean-Baptiste Rousseau

DESCRIPTION: Lauri treated the subject of Pan and the Bacchanalia on various occasions.
AUTHOR: LAURI, Filippo
TITLE: Bacchanal

DESCRIPTION: This signed and dated painting depicts a Bacchanal, a group of figures merrily dancing and drinking while others make a devotion of flowers to Pan, the Greek god of nature, shepherds, hunting and music.
AUTHOR: LAURI, Filippo
TITLE: Bacchanal

DESCRIPTION: In the centre, a maenad and a satyr dance and to the right other satyrs drink and putti play music.
AUTHOR: LAURI, Filippo
TITLE: Bacchanal

DESCRIPTION: Most striking among the revellers is the urinating child; Lauri may have been inspired by the presence of a similar putti in Titian's early masterpiece, the Bacchanal of the Andrians.
AUTHOR: LAURI, Filippo
TITLE: Bacchanal

DESCRIPTION: Lauri's speciality was the ideal landscape with mythological subjects into which he introduced stylistic elements from Francesco Albani, Pier Francesco Mola and Gaspard Dughet.
AUTHOR: LAURI, Filippo
TITLE: Endymion and Selene

DESCRIPTION: He painted small-scale Arcadian idylls executed with open brushwork in a light colour scheme.
AUTHOR: LAURI, Filippo
TITLE: Endymion and Selene

DESCRIPTION: The present painting, belonging to a series of six copper panels, is a characteristic example
AUTHOR: LAURI, Filippo
TITLE: Endymion and Selene

DESCRIPTION: The subject was inspired by the 16th-century epic poem 'Gerusalemme Liberata' (Jerusalem Delivered) by Torquato Tasso (1544-1595).
AUTHOR: LAZZARINI, Gregorio
TITLE: Rinaldo and Armida

DESCRIPTION: Rinaldo and Armida are a pair of lovers in the poem which is an idealized account of the first Crusade which ended with the capture of Jerusalem in 1099 and the establishment of a Christian kingdom.
AUTHOR: LAZZARINI, Gregorio
TITLE: Rinaldo and Armida

DESCRIPTION: Armida, a beautiful virgin witch, had been sent by Satan (whose aid the Saracens had enlisted0 to bring about the Crusaders' undoing by sorcery.
AUTHOR: LAZZARINI, Gregorio
TITLE: Rinaldo and Armida

DESCRIPTION: She sought revenge on the Christian prince Rinaldo after he had rescued his companions whom she had changed into monsters.
AUTHOR: LAZZARINI, Gregorio
TITLE: Rinaldo and Armida

DESCRIPTION: The pastoral story of hate turned of love, of the lovers' dalliance in Armida's magic kingdom, and Rinaldo's final desertion of her, forms a sequence of themes that were widely popular with Italian and French artists in the 17th and 18th centuries.
AUTHOR: LAZZARINI, Gregorio
TITLE: Rinaldo and Armida

DESCRIPTION: In this elegant genre scene, a young woman holding a guitar with her hand tries to play the instrument.
AUTHOR: LEERMANS, Pieter

DESCRIPTION: The most striking element within the composition is the woman leaning out of the window.
AUTHOR: LEERMANS, Pieter
TITLE: Young Woman with Guitar

DESCRIPTION: Her main role in this painting is to represent the five senses: touch, smell, taste, sight, and hearing.
AUTHOR: LEERMANS, Pieter
TITLE: Young Woman with Guitar

DESCRIPTION: Hearing symbolized by the guitar, touch and sight by the butterfly, smell by the perfume of the plant, and taste by the oranges on top of the rock.

DESCRIPTION: A work that would seem to evoke the sketches of a young Leonardo freed from Verrocchio's tutelage, though nevertheless still affected by a passion and taste for the soft textures and dazzle of solid material (as practiced in the workshop of the Florentine artist), is the Madonna sometimes referred to as the Madonna of the Carnation or "Madonna of the flowers".This painting is a free variant of the Benois Madonna in the Hermitage, being more complex in its composition and spatial arrangement, though perhaps somewhat highflown and less spontaneous.
AUTHOR: LEONARDO da Vinci
TITLE: The Madonna of the Carnation

DESCRIPTION: How it arrived at the Alte Pinakothek in Munich, after its acquisition by a private German collector, is unknown to us.
AUTHOR: LEONARDO da Vinci
TITLE: The Madonna of the Carnation

DESCRIPTION: What is certain is that after a comprehensible, temporary attribution to Verrocchio or his shop, art critics subsequently almost universally assigned the painting to Leonardo, a jjudgment backed up by the most recent research.
AUTHOR: LEONARDO da Vinci
TITLE: The Madonna of the Carnation

DESCRIPTION: In fact, the richness of the drapery, the vastness of the mountain scenery with purple and gold hues tingeing the foothills of peaks that fade into the sky, the vitality of the cut flowers in the crystal vase and the softness of the Child's flesh that foreshadows the tender putti of the Virgin of the Rocks, are elements that show a distancing from the more distinctive Verrocchiesque style and instead assume those formal and chromatic characteristics that would be the mature Leonardo's very own.
AUTHOR: LEONARDO da Vinci
TITLE: The Madonna of the Carnation

DESCRIPTION: Moreover, we should not overlook the striking similarities - in facial features and other details - with the Benois Madonna already mentioned (the gem fastening the Virgin's gown over her breast) and with the Uffizi Annunciation, works that in their figurative and expressive invention quite clearly reveal the stamp of Leonardo
AUTHOR: LEONARDO da Vinci
TITLE: The Madonna of the Carnation

DESCRIPTION: In about 370, St Jerome, later a Father of the Church, is said to have withdrawn to live as a hermit in the desert of Chalcis near Antioch, in order to produce a translation of the Bible and live as an ascetic.
AUTHOR: LEONARDO da Vinci
TITLE: St Jerome

DESCRIPTION: Leonardo depicts the Father of the Church as a penitent, not a scholar.
AUTHOR: LEONARDO da Vinci
TITLE: St Jerome

DESCRIPTION: St Jerome is kneeling in a humble posture that arouses our sympathy, in front of the sketched cross of Christ on the right, and before him lies the lion, his attribute.
AUTHOR: LEONARDO da Vinci
TITLE: St Jerome

DESCRIPTION: In his right hand he is holding a stone with which he is striking his breast.
AUTHOR: LEONARDO da Vinci
TITLE: St Jerome

DESCRIPTION: The head section of the unfinished panel was sawn out in the 18th century and not replaced and restored until the 19th century
AUTHOR: LEONARDO da Vinci
TITLE: St Jerome

DESCRIPTION: This sensitive portrait of Ludovico, turning his head to meet the gaze of the viewer, must have been painted by Ottavio Leoni shortly after Ludovico, a protégé of Pope Gregory XV (1621-1623), became cardinal.
AUTHOR: LEONI, Ottavio
TITLE: Portrait of Cardinal Ludovico Ludovisi

DESCRIPTION: Wearing the ring symbolic of his new office, his lively right hand grasps the chair, while his left hand languidly holds a letter, likely alluding to Ludovico's duties as secretary of state.
AUTHOR: LEONI, Ottavio
TITLE: Portrait of Cardinal Ludovico Ludovisi

DESCRIPTION: In the seated, three-quarter length format the influence of Raphael can be noted
AUTHOR: LEONI, Ottavio
TITLE: Portrait of Cardinal Ludovico Ludovisi

DESCRIPTION: Several versions of Lucas's popular painting survive
AUTHOR: LEYDEN, Lucas van

DESCRIPTION: The story of the destruction of Sodom, Lot's escape, and his subsequent seduction by his two daughters is told in Genesis.
AUTHOR: LEYDEN, Lucas van
TITLE: Lot and his Daughters

DESCRIPTION: Lot and his family were allowed to leave the city on condition that they did not look back.
AUTHOR: LEYDEN, Lucas van
TITLE: Lot and his Daughters

DESCRIPTION: Lot's wife disobeyed the instruction and was turned into a pillar of salt.
AUTHOR: LEYDEN, Lucas van
TITLE: Lot and his Daughters

DESCRIPTION: Lot continued on with his daughters.
AUTHOR: LEYDEN, Lucas van
TITLE: Lot and his Daughters

DESCRIPTION: Since their husbands had not fled with them, the daughters said to each other: "Our father is old and there is not a man in the country to come to us in the usual way.
AUTHOR: LEYDEN, Lucas van
TITLE: Lot and his Daughters

DESCRIPTION: Come now, let us make our father drink wine and then lie with him and in this way keep the family alive through our father."
AUTHOR: LEYDEN, Lucas van
TITLE: Lot and his Daughters

DESCRIPTION: The sons born of this union subsequently founded the tribes of the Moabites and the Ammonites.Both as a strongly erotic group painting and as a history painting, the subject was a popular one in the 16th and 17th century.
AUTHOR: LEYDEN, Lucas van
TITLE: Lot and his Daughters

DESCRIPTION: This painting, whose attribution to van Leyden - said to have executed his first commission at the age of twelve - is not altogether certain, falls into the second category.
AUTHOR: LEYDEN, Lucas van
TITLE: Lot and his Daughters

DESCRIPTION: Alongside the group in the foreground, the destruction of Sodom seen in the left-hand background establishes a second point of focus.
AUTHOR: LEYDEN, Lucas van
TITLE: Lot and his Daughters

DESCRIPTION: Influenced by Patenier, the painter portrays a kind of "global landscape" extending from the front left-hand corner into the depths of the composition.
AUTHOR: LEYDEN, Lucas van

DESCRIPTION: He thereby devotes particular care to the execution of the landscape details
AUTHOR: LEYDEN, Lucas van
TITLE: Lot and his Daughters

DESCRIPTION: Judith Leyster is one of the very few women to have been accepted as a member of the Haarlem Guild of Painters.
AUTHOR: LEYSTER, Judith
TITLE: Carousing Couple

DESCRIPTION: Although a contemporary historian described her as a leading light in art (punning on her name Leyster, which means "lodestar") she remained unknown for a long time and her works were either believed lost, or were attributed to Frans Hals.
AUTHOR: LEYSTER, Judith
TITLE: Carousing Couple

DESCRIPTION: She probably worked in his studio around 1630 and was also a friend of his family, for one year later she became godmother to Hals' daughter Maria.Like Hals at the same time, the young Leyster adopted the style of the Utrecht Caravaggisti, with their strong chiaroscuro modelling in the manner of Caravaggio.
AUTHOR: LEYSTER, Judith
TITLE: Carousing Couple

DESCRIPTION: From the mid-1620, she concentrated more on vividly illuminated genre scenes, generally featuring half figures of merry musicians, gamblers and whores, strongly influenced by the painting of Terbrugghen and Honthorst.While the Utrecht school of painters still rounded the surfaces of their objects smoothly between light and shade, Hals and his school adopted a broad, vibrant and independent brushstroke.
AUTHOR: LEYSTER, Judith
TITLE: Carousing Couple

DESCRIPTION: Leyster's work can be distinguished from that of Hals through her generally more discordant handling of colour, her sketchier treatment of hands, the wryly distorted smiles of her figures and her altogether flightier brushwork
AUTHOR: LEYSTER, Judith
TITLE: Carousing Couple

AUTHOR: LIBERALE da Verona

DESCRIPTION: Liebermann's Munich Beer Garden most strikingly reveals his debt to Menzel
AUTHOR: LIEBERMANN, Max
TITLE: Munich Beer Garden

DESCRIPTION: A member of a wealthy family, Liebermann devoted the first part of his career to simple subjects from the lives of peasants and craftsmen.
AUTHOR: LIEBERMANN, Max
TITLE: In the Field

DESCRIPTION: This pastel is one of the last in this series.
AUTHOR: LIEBERMANN, Max
TITLE: In the Field

DESCRIPTION: In the 1890s, he moved from social subject matter to joyful, light-filled landscape and interior
AUTHOR: LIEBERMANN, Max
TITLE: In the Field

DESCRIPTION: This painting is part of a series of four representing the personification of the four elements and the four ages of man.
AUTHOR: LIEVENS, Jan
TITLE: The Four Elements and Ages of Man: Water and Old Age

DESCRIPTION: The fourth painting of the series combines water with old age.
AUTHOR: LIEVENS, Jan
TITLE: The Four Elements and Ages of Man: Water and Old Age

DESCRIPTION: Old Age is depicted as a fishmonger with pail and fish-tube.
AUTHOR: LIEVENS, Jan
TITLE: The Four Elements and Ages of Man: Water and Old Age

DESCRIPTION: The painting depicts the head and shoulders of an old bearded man.
AUTHOR: LIEVENS, Jan
TITLE: A Tronie

DESCRIPTION: The fanciful studies from life, often exotically costumed, that Lievens, Rembrandt, and their followers painted in large numbers are not portraits as such and are known as tronies, the term for them that was in use at least by 1630.
AUTHOR: LIEVENS, Jan
TITLE: A Tronie

DESCRIPTION: Those depicting old bearded men are sometimes known generically as prophets; here old age is associated with wisdom, not folly
AUTHOR: LIEVENS, Jan
TITLE: A Tronie

DESCRIPTION: The painting depicts a group of hunters resting beside a fountain amidst ruins
AUTHOR: LIN, Herman van
TITLE: Resting Hunters

DESCRIPTION: In this still-life the Five Senses are represented in the form of objects.
AUTHOR: LINARD, Jacques
TITLE: The Five Senses

DESCRIPTION: Hearing is clearly given a greater value than all the other senses.
AUTHOR: LINARD, Jacques
TITLE: The Five Senses

DESCRIPTION: The open hymn-book with the words of thanksgiving 'Laudate dominum' forms a clear contrast to the reprehensible game of cards and the empty purse beside it - two objects representing the sense of touch
AUTHOR: LINARD, Jacques
TITLE: The Five Senses

DESCRIPTION: The painting shows a still-life of strawberries, grapes, plums and a peach in a basket surrounded by flowers and other fruits and vegetables, all resting on a marble ledge.Linthorst often used strong whites with thin strokes of colour, thus giving his flowers and fruit a delicate and almost translucent appearance, as can be seen in particular in the grapes in this still-life.
AUTHOR: LINTHORST, Jacobus
TITLE: Still-Life

DESCRIPTION: The picture shows a view of the Carafa Chapel from the transept of Santa Maria sopra Minerva in Rome.
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Filippino
TITLE: View of the Carafa Chapel

DESCRIPTION: The chapel is decorated with the frescoes of Filippino Lippi, executed in 1489-91
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Filippino
TITLE: View of the Carafa Chapel

DESCRIPTION: The Annunciation appears to be on a panel but in reality it is fresco while the frame, which mimics carved wood, is of gilded stucco
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Filippino
TITLE: Annunciation

DESCRIPTION: Close in both style and dimensions, the Pietà in the Museo Poldi Pezzoli and the Penitent St Jerome in Altenburg are essentially pendants, conceived and executed at about the same time.
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Fra Filippo
TITLE: Piet?

DESCRIPTION: They were intended for private devotion.This painting, executed on an arched panel, is an extraordinarily refined Imago Pietatis: the dead Christ appears to rise from a sarcophagus attended by the Virgin and St John the Evangelist.
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Fra Filippo
TITLE: Piet?

DESCRIPTION: Christ's body is wrapped in a shroud that leaves his torso exposed; his mother holds his head with her left arm, as the Evangelist supports Christ at the waist.
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Fra Filippo
TITLE: Piet?

DESCRIPTION: The composition is not perfectly aligned with the central axis; instead the figures and the sarcophagus are shifted slightly to the right
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Fra Filippo
TITLE: Piet?

DESCRIPTION: The work probably dates from the artist's early career.
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Fra Filippo
TITLE: Madonna and Child with Saints, Angels, and a Donor

DESCRIPTION: It may be the first indoor sacra conversazione in the history of Italian painting.In Florence in the first half of the fifteenth century the market for devotional images was dominated by sculpture, not painting.
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Fra Filippo
TITLE: Madonna and Child with Saints, Angels, and a Donor

DESCRIPTION: Consequently, sculptural reliefs exerted a profound influence on painted compositions of the Madonna and Child.
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Fra Filippo
TITLE: Madonna and Child with Saints, Angels, and a Donor

DESCRIPTION: This early painting by Filippo Lippi takes its inspiration from a marble relief from the workshop of Donatello (Victoria and Albert Museum, London) that also exists in molded versions
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Fra Filippo
TITLE: Madonna and Child with Saints, Angels, and a Donor

DESCRIPTION: This  is an early version of the theme of Annunciation which Fra Filippo Lippi treated several times during his career.
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Fra Filippo
TITLE: The Annunciation

DESCRIPTION: Lippi shows the figures caught in a diagonal shaft of light that falls across the back of the angel and illuminates the Virgin by passing through an open door notionally located behind a pilaster with engaged columns.
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Fra Filippo
TITLE: The Annunciation

DESCRIPTION: The bilateral division of the Annunciation by a prominent architectural feature is a hallmark of Lippi's early work
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Fra Filippo
TITLE: The Annunciation

DESCRIPTION: This painting was commissioned by Cosimo de' Medici.
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Fra Filippo
TITLE: Madonna and Child

DESCRIPTION: It is still in the Palazzo Medici Riccardi in Florence.Orphaned at a young age, Filippo Lippi was raised in the Carmelite convent of Santa Maria in Florence, where he would undoubtedly have seen Masaccio and Masolino at work on the frescoes in the Brancacci chapel.
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Fra Filippo
TITLE: Madonna and Child

DESCRIPTION: He took vows himself, but proved to be wholly unsuited to religious life.
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Fra Filippo
TITLE: Madonna and Child

DESCRIPTION: His name surfaces often in court documents.
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Fra Filippo
TITLE: Madonna and Child

DESCRIPTION: Tried for embezzlement (even tortured on the rack), he lived openly with a Carmelite nun, Lucretia Buti, who was his model and with whom he had a son -- painter Filippino  Lippi.
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Fra Filippo
TITLE: Madonna and Child

DESCRIPTION: His patron Cosimo de' Medici sheltered Filippo in "protective custody" at the Medici palace, hoping to prod him into finishing tardy commissions, but the artist escaped.
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Fra Filippo
TITLE: Madonna and Child

DESCRIPTION: He was eventually allowed to leave his order and marry Lucretia, but continued to wear a monk's habit and sign his works Fra ("brother") Filippo.Filippo's Virgin is wistful and slightly melancholy, while the infant's heavy, almost muscular form recalls Masaccio's emphatically three-dimensional figures.
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Fra Filippo
TITLE: Madonna and Child

DESCRIPTION: Masaccio had used strongly directional light to reveal the form of his figures.
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Fra Filippo
TITLE: Madonna and Child

DESCRIPTION: Filippo's Virgin and child, on the other hand, are bathed in an overall glow that prevents the modeling of the figures from overpowering the graceful and well-defined line of his composition.
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Fra Filippo
TITLE: Madonna and Child

DESCRIPTION: As Filippo grew older his reliance on line increased and Masaccio's influence lessened
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Fra Filippo
TITLE: Madonna and Child

DESCRIPTION: The provenance of this panel has been connected to the Church of Sant'Egidio in Florence.
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Fra Filippo
TITLE: Annunciation with two Kneeling Donors

DESCRIPTION: At some point, the painting was probably cut down on the left side.
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Fra Filippo
TITLE: Annunciation with two Kneeling Donors

DESCRIPTION: On the basis of the hypothetical identification of the portrayed donors as Andrea and Lorenzo d'Ilarione de' Bardi, early scholars assumed that the picture could date to no earlier than 1452, and more likely to a bit later.
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Fra Filippo
TITLE: Annunciation with two Kneeling Donors

DESCRIPTION: Successive art historians have moved the painting to the early 1440's, comparing it to the Annunciation in Munich and recognizing in it the beginnings of Lippi's attachment to the style of Fra Angelico.
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Fra Filippo
TITLE: Annunciation with two Kneeling Donors

DESCRIPTION: The participation of Andrea del Castagno has also been suggested, with a date of around 1440.
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Fra Filippo
TITLE: Annunciation with two Kneeling Donors

DESCRIPTION: The portraits of the donors, more recently identified as Folco Portinari and Folgonaccio, were probably carried out with the help of an assistant
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Fra Filippo
TITLE: Annunciation with two Kneeling Donors

DESCRIPTION: The view of the left (north) wall of the main chapel represents, in the lunette, birth and boyhood of St Stephen; in the middle register, Stephen is consecrated to the priesthood and takes leave of Bishop Julian, returns home, exorcises the changeling, and disputes with the Pharisees; in the bottom register, the funeral of St Stephen and, extending across the east wall, his martyrdom
AUTHOR: LIPPI, Fra Filippo
TITLE: View of the left (north) wall of the main chapel

DESCRIPTION: In his second Epistle to the Corinthians, St Paul describes the revelations that were made to him.
AUTHOR: LISS, Johann
TITLE: The Ecstasy of St Paul

DESCRIPTION: Liss portrays one of the apostle's visions, `how that he was caught up into paradise, and heard unspeakable words, which it is not lawful for a man to utter'.
AUTHOR: LISS, Johann
TITLE: The Ecstasy of St Paul

DESCRIPTION: Above the seated apostle, who is surrounded by books, an angel draws aside a curtain; terrified, Paul shrinks back from the expanse of heaven revealed to him.
AUTHOR: LISS, Johann
TITLE: The Ecstasy of St Paul

DESCRIPTION: Angels playing musical instruments gambol in the clouds, and in the distance the Trinity appears.
AUTHOR: LISS, Johann
TITLE: The Ecstasy of St Paul

DESCRIPTION: The colours range from the deep violet of Paul's cloak through the green of the curtain to the most delicate yellow, blue and pink of the clouds.
AUTHOR: LISS, Johann
TITLE: The Ecstasy of St Paul

DESCRIPTION: This painting with its extraordinary wealth of brilliant colour is one of the artist's finest works and seems to anticipate the Venetian painting of the eighteenth century.With the exception of Adam Elsheimer, Johann Liss was the most outstanding German painter of the seventeenth century.
AUTHOR: LISS, Johann
TITLE: The Ecstasy of St Paul

DESCRIPTION: He was born in Schleswig-Holstein c.
AUTHOR: LISS, Johann
TITLE: The Ecstasy of St Paul

DESCRIPTION: 1597, spent several years studying in the Netherlands, where he came into contact with the Haarlem painters, principally Goltzius and Buytewech, and with the Flemish followers of Caravaggio in Antwerp (Janssens, Jordaens).
AUTHOR: LISS, Johann
TITLE: The Ecstasy of St Paul

DESCRIPTION: Liss then made his way to Italy via Paris.
AUTHOR: LISS, Johann
TITLE: The Ecstasy of St Paul

DESCRIPTION: To begin with, he worked in Rome, where he was a member of the Netherlandish artists' colony, and exactly when he settled in Venice is not known.
AUTHOR: LISS, Johann
TITLE: The Ecstasy of St Paul

DESCRIPTION: Until his early death, supposedly a victim of the plague which broke out in 1629, he continued to work in Venice and it was in these last years that he produced his best-known works, among them The Ecstasy of St Paul.
AUTHOR: LISS, Johann
TITLE: The Ecstasy of St Paul

DESCRIPTION: Together with Domenico Feti, Liss played an important part in reviving the use of rich colours, a Venetian tradition which had ended with Tintoretto.In the seventeenth century this painting was in the famous collection of the Amsterdam merchant Gerrit Reynst (died 1658), which consisted mainly of works by Venetian masters and included a companion-piece, The Vision of St Peter, which was subsequently lost.
AUTHOR: LISS, Johann
TITLE: The Ecstasy of St Paul

DESCRIPTION: Both pictures were engraved by Jeremias Falck and attributed to Johann Liss, but it seems certain that the St Peter picture was not the work of Liss but of Domenico Feti, who was a close friend of the German painter.
AUTHOR: LISS, Johann
TITLE: The Ecstasy of St Paul

DESCRIPTION: It may be that after Feti's death (1623), his patron decided to commission Johann Liss to paint the companion-picture to the St Peter.
AUTHOR: LISS, Johann
TITLE: The Ecstasy of St Paul

DESCRIPTION: The Ecstasy of St Paul came up for sale in Amsterdam in 1722 with the Van de Amory Collection and found its way through a Florentine art-dealer into the Berlin collection of A. von Frey, from which it passed in 1919 to the Picture Gallery
AUTHOR: LISS, Johann
TITLE: The Ecstasy of St Paul

DESCRIPTION: From 1507 Llanos collaborated with Fernando Yáñez in the execution of the retable for the high altar in the Valencia Cathedral.
AUTHOR: LLANOS, Fernando
TITLE: Rest during the Flight to Egypt

DESCRIPTION: He produced 12 rectangular panels dedicated to he life of the Virgin.
AUTHOR: LLANOS, Fernando
TITLE: Rest during the Flight to Egypt

DESCRIPTION: Although it is difficult to differentiate between the works of Llanos and Yáñez, critics universally accept Rest during the Flight to Egypt as the work by Llanos
AUTHOR: LLANOS, Fernando
TITLE: Rest during the Flight to Egypt

DESCRIPTION: Locatelli, an important landscape and genre painter in Rome, occasionally also painted vedute.
AUTHOR: LOCATELLI, Andrea
TITLE: Market in the Piazza Navona in Rome

DESCRIPTION: The present view is taken from a raised viewpoint from the narrow side of the Piazza Navona on a market day.
AUTHOR: LOCATELLI, Andrea
TITLE: Market in the Piazza Navona in Rome

DESCRIPTION: At the left, the long front of the Palazzo Doria Pamphilj and the adjoined church of Sant'Agnese dominate the picture.
AUTHOR: LOCATELLI, Andrea
TITLE: Market in the Piazza Navona in Rome

DESCRIPTION: In the centre, Bernini's famous fountain can be seen
AUTHOR: LOCATELLI, Andrea
TITLE: Market in the Piazza Navona in Rome

DESCRIPTION: The subject of the painting is taken from Ovid's Metamorphoses.
AUTHOR: LOCATELLI, Andrea
TITLE: Landscape with Mercury and Argus

DESCRIPTION: The painter treated this theme several times
AUTHOR: LOCATELLI, Andrea
TITLE: Landscape with Mercury and Argus

DESCRIPTION: Loir concentrated his oeuvre on scenes of the city.
AUTHOR: LOIR, Luigi
TITLE: Carousel at the Porte Dorée
